Who we are looking for: VML is looking for a Project Manager (Freelance) with a breadth and depth of expertise to champion omni-channel work across multiple work streams with a focus on the Brand and the consumer at the center. This is an exciting opportunity to lead the delivery of innovative solutions bringing together creative, data and technology across the entire customer journey. To be successful in this role, you must possess agency experience in both digital and integrated marketing, building digital experiences and creating compelling content. You must have a strong creative sensibility, a genuine interest in user-centered design, and a hands-on understanding of content production for all channels. In this role, you will be responsible for leading talented teams to understand client needs, market forces and consumer sentiments to deliver effective solutions. You will be accountable for ensuring all project deliverables are of high-quality, completed on time and on budget, and are aligned with the brand’s goals. You must have the ability to maintain the broad vision required for executing a project, including strategic thinking and leadership from beginning to end, as well as the talent for overseeing all the small details that add up to fulfilling our commitment to client satisfaction and project requirements. The ideal candidate will be an innovator who is excited to roll up their sleeves and get into the details to build processes that drive business. What you'll do: Work | Deliver work that is excellent, on time, on budget AND goes beyond the brief. You will be responsible for setting up plans and processes that drive projects forward and ensure successful delivery with high client satisfaction. People | Motivate, direct and challenge teams to produce great work. You will be responsible for establishing and managing cross-functional teams across different locations that are collaborative, efficient and high-functioning. Process | Establish and manage program communication and process. You will be responsible for setting up appropriate structure and tools to ensure successful collaboration and engagement across agency and client teams. Financials | Responsible for project estimation, planning and profitability. You will be responsible for building detailed project plans; managing resource allocations; and reporting on project status, burn rates, budgets and reconciliations to agency and client stakeholders. Who you are: A builder | Process-oriented and an innovator with a strong point of view and distinct voice. Ability and appetite to create and bring people together and inspire solutions. Optimistic, open and collaborative | Our team is close-knit and supportive and we’re working with a lot of unknowns – you must be an advocate of environments that are comfortable with ambiguity, positive and encourage collaboration. Ego-less | We all wear the hats that need wearing, it’s a mentality that makes the team successful. What you'll need: 3+ years of hands-on project management experience in an advertising or marketing communications company, ideally at a creative agency or with Brand focused project work. Proven track record in driving creative solutions and digital content creation. Knowledge of social and mobile content creation and requirements for different channels. Customer experience and journey mapping, e-commerce, retail and consumer brand marketing experience are highly desired. Good understanding of emerging web standards, user-centered design (UX/UI), optimization and search practices. Experience working on large-scale integrated, omnichannel programs with multiple parallel work streams and diverse teams (UX, Tech, Strategy, Creative, Account, Research and Data) across VML's U.S. offices. High EQ and the ability to read what a team needs to help motivate them. Self-motivated and driven to build and create great work. Show more Show less

Your Role Matters Keyrus is looking for a senior manager to strengthen its advisory services for the Business Intelligence and Information management (BI/IM) service line in Belgium. In order to face the digital-era challenges of tomorrow, we aim to provide our clients with the best weapons to prepare for the big data and digital battles, to leverage their past investments and to deploy new business intelligence paradigms that smoothly reconcile traditional and innovative technologies to leverage the best of information assets. As a senior manager you will accompany, end-to-end, our clients in their journey from starting, improving and/or implementing BI/IM initiatives. Therefore you will establish and maintain good relationships at an executive/decision making level in different sectors and functions. Depending on your experience and aspirations, your main responsibilities will include some of the following: Facilitating workshops to gather and challenge the requirements and needs of clients Analysing and translating these requirements into a high-level solution design and estimate the workload, cost and timing to implement this Communicating and convincing executives of the value and benefits of a BI/IM solution Advising clients what BI/IM strategy they should follow and on the governance models to support this strategy Assisting in the pre-sales process by writing proposals for BI/IM solutions or accompanying the account managers in meetings with prospects or clients Participating in developing new services and solutions Managing a team of consultants as Project/Program Manager or in the role of a client executive You may also take the lead in the implementation of various projects for a BI, DWH, MDM, DQM, CPM or Big Data & Analytics solution. This can be as a project manager or lead architect depending on your skills and aspirations. If you feel you have what it takes to join a leader in the digital transformation area, if you want to thrive in a challenging environment of collaboration and flexibility, if you are eager to learn new skills to achieve your full potential and if you are a team player, then Keyrus is the right company for you! You Matter! Being a part of Keyrus as a Manager means being an ambassador, coach and consultant. You have a good understanding of the business, technical and organizational requirements, drivers and challenges in different sectors. You are able to capture and link these to the abilities of a BI/IM solution (BI, data warehouse, data governance, data quality, master data management or more advanced big data/analytic solutions) You have obtained this understanding over a minimum of 10 years as a consultant or as a manager in this area and with a proven track record in helping to architect or to manage business intelligence or information management solutions. Passionate and highly experienced in convincing C-Level, senior executive leaders and stakeholders of the business in the benefits and the value of a BI/IM solution. You have experience in, or at least have a very good understanding of some BI, IM, CPM and/or Big Data technologies such as: SAP Business Objects, IBM Cognos, SAS, Oracle, Microstrategy, Microsoft, Informatica, Tableau, Talend, Qlik, Hadoop, or other Big Data framework. Excellent communication and listening skills. Strong conceptual, methodical, analytical and strategic thinking as well as the ability to adapt in a fast-paced and challenging environment. Good presentations skills are also an absolute must as is knowing the tools that will allow you to deliver high level presentations to both functional as well as technical audiences. You will be able to speak and write English, Dutch and French fluently. You have a Master degree in economics, commercial engineer, commercial science or computer science. And How We Reward You Matters... Keyrus offers a working environment and projects that attract the best people working in Data, Digital and Business Transformation. Working on diverse and challenging projects, you will have the opportunity to develop multi-disciplinary skills to help you build a strong career path. To support you in this we have a digital learning platform with access to over 30,000 training courses as well as courses created by our experts. We dedicate a generous training budget that allows you to manage your career path at a pace that suits you. We have also implemented an Agile Performance Management framework, where strength-based coaching, aligned company goals, alongside regular check-ins and feedback managed throughout the year are at the heart of our people management strategy. Our generous and flexible salary package gives you the choice between: A mobility budget that you can utilize for sustainable transportation, housing costs (rent or mortgage) and/or cash Traditional petrol or electric car and a fuel card On top of these two options, you will also receive net allowances, eco vouchers, hospitalisation (DKV) insurance & group insurance and a bonus scheme to use on our cafeteria plan. Keyrus gives you the chance to develop your career alongside leaders in data, digital and management and transformation. Our project and clients at the heart of data and digital transformation changing the world we live in for the better, making data matter. Keyrus Matters Keyrus, creator of value in the era of Data and Digital. Keyrus is dedicated to helping enterprises take advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability. Keyrus in Belgium employs 200 highly skilled consultants and is part of the international Keyrus Group, an international player in consulting and technologies and a specialist in Data and Digital. Created in 1996, listed on Euronext's Eurolist, with consolidated revenues of €289.1m in 2021 and with more than 3200 employees in 22 countries, the Keyrus Group offers the performance, solidity and know-how of a large professional services organisation, whilst preserving the agility of a young company. #makedatamatter Keyrus is a specialist in performance management consulting and the integration of innovative technological solutions in the Data and Digital fields. Over the last 28 years, the Group has developed its expertise and skills in helping companies to optimise their performance and meet the challenges linked to their transformation. Find out more on our services on keyrus.com/be. Show more Show less

job_title: Managing Director, Forensics Data Breach Leader
job_summary: Job Summary JOB DESCRIPTION The Managing Director, Forensic Technology will be responsible for working with practice leadership to design, implement and drive the Data Breach Review (“DBR”) service line strategy. Additionally, this role will work closely with practice leadership and peers from inside and outside the Forensic Technology Services practice to continually improve, evolve and ensure the DBR service line is addressing industry demands, while maintaining an acceptable margin. The Managing Director will also be responsible for directly managing a team, potentially based both inside and outside of the US. Job Duties Management Responsibilities: Actively collaborates with practice leadership in the design & implementation of the service line strategy Designs and implements the overall Data Breach Review service line, including, but not limited to, the initial business plan and the go-to-market sales strategy Collaborates with practice leaders and peers in the design of proprietary offerings and workflows using a blend of commercial and custom software Establishes and maintains scalable staffing models necessary to efficiently support multiple projects of varying sizes both domestically and internationally Serves as the primary service line's Subject Matter Expert (SME) both internally to the Firm and externally to current clients and potential prospects Manages service line economics to achieve the mutually defined service line financial goals Demonstrates ability to directly engage, supervise, collaborate, and manage BDO teams consistent with BDO's core values Business Development Responsibilities Engages existing network to identify and develops new clients both individually and as part of a broader BDO client engagement team Collaborates and educates internal resources on the composition and differentiators of the existing Data Breach Review service line Drafts and delivers Data Breach Review proposals that satisfy the client’s primary objectives Client Responsibilities Responds directly and timely to all client requests Develops, communicates, manages, and executes project plans for clients, including consultations on processes and tools to meet and exceed client goals Supervises a portfolio of clients & projects while providing strategic guidance to the respective document review teams Stays on top of trends, new tools, and overall knowledge of the e-discovery marketplace in the service of our clients Translates highly technical information to non-technical clients Portrays exceptional organizational skills Operational And Technical Responsibilities Applies competencies in multiple applicable technologies, such as RelativityOne, Canopy and others Applies competencies in advanced analytics, machine learning, document review methodologies, and knowledge of complex, expedited document review workflows Manages multiple workstreams across the assigned portfolio of clients including both upstream escalation paths and downstream day-to-day management Other related duties as required Supervisory Responsibilities Supervises the day-to-day workload of engagement staff and reviews work product, as appropriate Evaluates the performance of engagement staff and assists in the development of goals and objectives to enhance professional development, as appropriate Delivers periodic performance feedback and completes annual performance evaluations for engagement staff Acts as Career Advisor to staff, as assigned Education Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Bachelor's degree, required Juris Doctorate, preferred Experience Fifteen (15) or more years of experience within the eDiscovery industry, with multiple years of experience specific to Data Breach Review to include: proposals, engagements, business offerings and/or client strategy, required A strong business development acumen with the ability to own generating additional revenue for the practice, required Language Fluency in Spanish, Mandarin, Cantonese, French, German, and/or Hindi (read, speak, and/or write), preferred Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong analytical and critical thinking skills Proven ability to work in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously Solid organizational skills especially the ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details and quality Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and client personnel Provide an encouraging team atmosphere on engagements and contribute to the professional development of the team Strong and effective people management skills are a necessary component of this role Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate’s qualifications, experience, skills, and geography. National Range: $300,000 - $350,000 Maryland Range: $300,000 - $350,000 NYC/Long Island/Westchester Range: $300,000 - $350,000 About Us Join us at BDO, where you will find more than a career, you’ll find a place where your work is impactful, and you are valued for your individuality. We offer flexibility and opportunities for advancement. Our culture is centered around making meaningful connections, approaching interactions with curiosity, and being true to yourself, all while making a positive difference in the world. At BDO, our purpose of helping people thrive every day is at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are focused on delivering exceptional and sustainable outcomes and value for our people, our clients, and our communities. BDO is proud to be an ESOP company, reflecting a culture that puts people first, by sharing financially in our growth in value with our U.S. team. BDO professionals provide assurance, tax and advisory services for a diverse range of clients across the U.S. and in over 160 countries through our global organization. BDO is the first large accounting and advisory organization to implement an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). A qualified retirement plan, the ESOP offers participants a stake in the firm’s success through beneficial ownership and a unique opportunity to enhance their financial well-being. The ESOP stands as a compelling addition to our comprehensive compensation and Total Rewards benefits* offerings. The annual allocation to the ESOP is fully funded by BDO through investments in company stock and grants employees the chance to grow their wealth over time as their shares vest and grow in value with the firm’s success, with no employee contributions. We Are Committed To Delivering Exceptional Experiences To Middle Market Leaders By Sharing Insight-driven Perspectives, Helping Companies Take Business As Usual To Better Than Usual. With Industry Knowledge And Experience, a Breadth And Depth Of Resources, And Unwavering Commitment To Quality, We Pride Ourselves On Welcoming diverse perspectives and understanding the experience of our professionals and clients Empowering team members to explore their full potential Our talented team who brings varying skills, knowledge and experience to proactively help our clients navigate an expanding array of complex challenges and opportunities Celebrating ingenuity and innovation to transform our business and help our clients transform theirs Focus on resilience and sustainability to positively impact our people, clients, and communities BDO Total Rewards that encompass so much more than traditional “benefits.” Click here to find out more! Benefits may be subject to eligibility requirements. Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/vets Click here to find out more! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. "BDO USA, P.A. is an EO employer M/F/Veteran/Disability" Show more Show less

Stellen-Nr.: 76509 Gesellschaft: Bechtle AG Einsatzort(e): Neckarsulm, DE, 74172 Darmstadt, DE, 64295 Gaildorf, DE, 74405 Bereit für alles? Bereit für Bechtle. Mit über 15.000 Mitarbeitenden sind wir eines der erfolgreichsten IT-Unternehmen und Marktführer in unserer Branche. Die Kombination aus Direktvertrieb von IT-Produkten mit umfassenden Systemhausdienstleistungen macht uns zum zukunftsstarken IT-Partner für Mittelstand, Konzerne und öffentliche Auftraggeber. Wir sind zu Hause in ganz Europa und immer in der Nähe. Cybersecurity / IT Security Analyst (w/m/d) In deiner Mission blühst du auf, denn: Du verstärkst das Team unseres Security Operations Centers (SOC) – hier wehren wir ganzheitlich Cyberattacken auf die Daten und Infrastrukturen unserer Kunden ab. Kommt es zu Sicherheitsvorfällen, ergreifst du frühzeitig passende Gegenmaßnahmen, analysierst die Ursachen und überwachst zudem Anomalien und Schwachstellen innerhalb des SOC. Außerdem wertest du IT Security Logs über unser zentrales SIEM- und EDR-System aus und klassifizierst sie sorgfältig. Jeden IT Security Incident behandelst gewissenhaft und führst im Zuge dessen forensische Analysen durch. Kurzum: Mit deinen abgeleiteten Maßnahmen trägst du wesentlich zur Zukunftsfähigkeit unseres Sicherheitsniveaus bei. Deine Skills? Mehr als interessant: Abgeschlossenes Informatik-Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit Schwerpunkt IT Security Kenntnisse in Netzwerken, heterogenen IT-Infrastrukturen und Betriebssystemen sowie Web-Technologien Praxis mit Tools und Prozessen in der Bearbeitung von IT Security Incidents Gutes Englisch Und persönlich gefallen uns besonders deine analytische Denkweise und dein Spaß an Teamarbeit. Du verdienst echten Mehrwert. Freu dich deshalb auf: Weiterentwicklung: Mit einem umfangreichen Angebot der Bechtle Akademie, individueller Karriereplanung, Expert:innen- und Führungsprogrammen, Herstellerzertifizierungen und vielem mehr entwickelst du dich kontinuierlich weiter und bleibst niemals stehen. Flexibilität: Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du je nach Aufgabengebiet und in Abstimmung mit deiner Führungskraft individuell gestalten. Rund-um-Sorglos-Paket: Deine Zukunft ist uns wichtig. Das zeigt unsere attraktive Berufsunfähigkeitsversicherung sowie unsere betriebliche Altersversorgung mit einer Bezuschussung von bis zu 100 Prozent. Sicherheit: Als zukunftsstarker Arbeitgeber profitierst du von einer sicheren und unbefristeten Anstellung. Das erwartet dich bei der Bechtle AG: An unserem Hauptsitz in Neckarsulm sowie den weiteren Standorten in Gaildorf und Frankfurt arbeiten rund 700 Kolleginnen und Kollegen in unseren zentralen Services. Dazu zählen beispielsweise Abteilungen wie Finanzen, Recht, Human Resources, Digital Business oder Unternehmenskommunikation. Den größten Bereich bildet unsere interne IT mit über 230 Beschäftigten. Als Teil unserer zentralen Services unterstützt und berätst du die Bechtle Gesellschaften und damit über 15.000 Mitarbeitende. Tabea Oehmig | Recruiting | +49 (0) 7132 981-4321 Bereit für all das? Jetzt über unser Online-Bewerbungstool bewerben, auch ohne Anschreiben. Profilvorschläge von Personaldienstleistern und Bewerbungen per E-Mail können wir leider nicht berücksichtigen. Jetzt bewerben » Wir lehnen jegliche Form von Diskriminierung ab, denn Vielfalt gehört zu uns. Bei uns hat jede:r Bewerber:in die gleichen Möglichkeiten – unabhängig von Geschlecht, sexueller Identität, Behinderung, Alter, ethnischer Herkunft sowie Religion oder Weltanschauung. If you have that unique blend of technical know-how and fantastic customer service abilities, we'd love to connect with you! We're searching for someone to help resolve Service Desk tickets, serve as a technical resource for both our clients and internal team, and support our commitment to delivering exceptional customer service. The perfect candidate will not only react promptly to client inquiries but also look for proactive ways to enhance the client experience. Please note, this is an on-site position based in Midland, TX. Requirements Your Experience and Qualities Needed: Critical thinking & troubleshooting skills - puzzle solving Experience troubleshooting or supporting Microsoft platforms (e.g. Office 365, Active Directory, all current flavors of Windows) A demonstrated history of pursuing learning objectives independently The ability to effectively manage client expectations around service delivery Customer service skills Goal oriented An empathetic person who has the ability to understand the perspective of our client's users Great communication skills Additional Certifications and Qualities We'd Love to See: MS900 AZ900 CompTIA A+ 2-4 years of IT Triage / Help Desk experience Knowledge of infrastructure hardware, networks & firewalls (VLANs, VPNs, VMWare ESXi, DNS Filtering, etc) High level ticket management Managed Service Provider (MSP) experience is a huge plus! Benefits CTSI offers a rich benefit package including the following: Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision) Flex Spending Account 401k Matching Life Insurance Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick, & 8 Paid Holidays) Training & Development Wellness Resources Financial Training Reimbursement Cell Phone Reimbursement Paid Certifications Performance Based Incentive Program Family-first mentality. (We believe family comes first. We want you to have a life outside of work & we understand that family time doesn't just happen on the weekends.) CTSI provides a fast, energetic work environment for those seeking technology careers. We're a top technology services provider in the Permian Basin and all of West Texas with a solid national reputation. But more than that, we're a tight-knit group of professionals who work collaboratively to provide the highest possible levels of customer service and support. Show more Show less

Your role Matters Keyrus Data Intelligence is currently looking for senior BI Consultants with a strong Qlik background to join its expanding team. If you’re passionate about business intelligence, data integration and would like to join a leader in consulting and solutions integration for business intelligence, big data & analytics and performance management on the Belgian market, please read on… As a senior Qlik consultant, you will be working closely with our clients to assist them in the full implementation process, ranging from facilitating the requirements definition, design, build, go-live and support phases. You will also help define and prioritise the roadmap activities, which will include model development, future enhancements and training. The Main Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited, To Facilitating requirements gathering and dashboard design workshops Create dashboard or mobile app prototypes Creating a functional and technical design to meet user requirements Developing and building solutions Guiding the customer during acceptance testing Coaching and supporting end users and Keyrus employees You will act as an adviser to optimise new and existing Qlik solutions which can be done by leveraging on the experiences of our senior consultants. In return, you will be given the opportunity to demonstrate your knowledge and experience to these same colleagues. As an experienced Qlik consultant, you will also be expected to help implement and maintain best practices across the entire implementation process and in the Keyrus Qlik CoE. Depending on your experience you will actively participate in Qlik pre-sales activities and advisory missions such as helping clients with their tool selections. You Matter! Professional experience as a consultant with at least 5 years’ experience working with the Qlik product stack (QlikSense, Qlikview, NPrinting, …) – a certification is considered as a plus It is a plus to have profound software architecture skills to set-up a state of the art Qlik architecture (eg. mature enough to consider the use of QVD files, basic data transformation, security methods, …). A good knowledge of user experience (UX) design for BI solutions. Good understanding of the data warehouse lifecycle, its architecture and modern data architectures (HADOOP, Cloud, …). Experience in working with Agile development frameworks. The successful candidate has a Bachelor or Master degree. Strong personal skills in communication and presentation, strong methodical and analytical thinking. You feel as comfortable with a technical audience as you do with a business audience. Keyrus operates throughout Belgium and therefore consultants will ideally speak English and French and/or Dutch fluently. And How We Reward You Matters... Keyrus offers a working environment and projects that attract the best people working in Data, Digital and Business Transformation. Working on diverse and challenging projects, you will have the opportunity to develop multi-disciplinary skills to help you build a strong career path. To support you in this we have a digital learning platform with access to over 30,000 training courses as well as courses created by our experts. We dedicate a generous training budget that allows you to manage your career path at a pace that suits you. We have also implemented an Agile Performance Management framework, where strength-based coaching, aligned company goals, alongside regular check-ins and feedback managed throughout the year are at the heart of our people management strategy. Our generous and flexible salary package gives you the choice between: A mobility budget that you can utilize for sustainable transportation, housing costs (rent or mortgage) and/or cash Traditional petrol or electric car and a fuel card On top of these two options, you will also receive net allowances, eco vouchers, hospitalisation (DKV) insurance & group insurance and a bonus scheme to use on our cafeteria plan. Keyrus Matters Keyrus, creator of value in the era of Data and Digital Keyrus is dedicated to helping enterprises take advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability. Keyrus in Belgium employs 200 highly skilled employees and is part of the international Keyrus Group, an international player in consulting and technologies and a specialist in Data and Digital. Stellen-Nr.: 77476 Gesellschaft: Bechtle GmbH Aachen Einsatzort(e): Aachen, DE, 52062 Würselen, DE, 52146 Bereit für deine Ausbildung? Mit über 15.000 Mitarbeitenden, darunter über 800 Auszubildende und dual Studierende, sind wir eines der erfolgreichsten IT-Unternehmen und Marktführer in unserer Branche. Die Kombination aus Direktvertrieb von IT-Produkten mit umfassenden Systemhausdienstleistungen macht uns zum zukunftsstarken IT-Partner für Mittelstand, Konzerne und öffentliche Auftraggeber. Wir sind zu Hause in ganz Europa und immer in der Nähe. Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker für Systemintegration (w/m/d) (Start 2025) Hier bewegst du etwas: Deine Ausbildung startet am 1. August 2025. Dein Beitrag ist uns wichtig, daher bist du von Anfang an in das Tagesgeschäft miteingebunden. Mittelpunkt deiner Ausbildung? Der Aufbau und die Anpassung von IT-Strukturen und -Netzwerken. Du bist gefragt, wenn es um die Wartung von Hard- und Software oder die Behebung von Störungen geht. Wie eine typische Woche für dich aussieht? Du bist etwa 3,5 Tage im Unternehmen und 1,5 Tage in der Berufsschule. Damit punktest du: Du hast eine abgeschlossene Fachhochschulreife oder eine allgemeine Hochschulreife oder stehst kurz vor dem Abschluss. Du hast Spaß an IT und digitalen Innovationen? Perfekt. Du hast bereits erste Erfahrungen mit Hard- und Software gesammelt, sei es privat oder durch ein Praktikum? Ein großer Pluspunkt. Du möchtest ein wichtiger Ansprechpartner sein, wenn es darum geht, Menschen bei IT-Problem zu helfen? Dann ist dein Weg bei uns für dich geebnet. Du hast eine offene Art, arbeitest selbstständig und liebst den Teamspirit? Bestens. Wir bieten mehr für dich: Deine Vergütung? Überdurchschnittlich und attraktiv! Je nach Ausbildungsjahr bis zu 1.350 Euro im Monat. Networking: Nutze unsere Einführungsveranstaltung, das Azubi Camp oder viele weitere Events, um dich mit anderen Azubis auszutauschen. Wir bieten dir Perspektiven: Deine Übernahmechancen stehen nach erfolgreichem Abschluss sehr gut. Du bist nicht allein: Neben deinem individuellen Paten, bist du in einem starken Team, das Wertschätzung und Verbundenheit liebt und lebt. Deine Entwicklung ist uns wichtig: Durch unseren Bechtle Learning Campus bieten wir dir ein umfangreiches Angebot in fachlicher und persönlicher Weiterentwicklung. Das erwartet dich im Bechtle IT-Systemhaus Aachen: Unser Standort befindet sich im Herzen des Gewerbegebiets Würselen, mit guter Verkehrsanbindung zum Autobahnkreuz Aachen. Es stehen ausreichend Parkmöglichkeiten zur Verfügung (auch Fahrrad-Parkplätze). Neben einem breiten Portfolio an IT-Lösungen verfügt unser Standort über einen Showroom für Modern Workplace Solutions, eine eigene Softwareabteilung, ein Competence Center zum Thema Red Hat und IBM sowie einen 24-/7-Support. Unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter schätzen neben modernen Equipment und flachen Hierarchien besonders die Fortbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Description: Join GlobalLogic, to be a valid part of the team working on a huge software project for the world-class company providing M2M / IoT 4G/5G modules e.g. to the automotive, healthcare and logistics industries. Through our engagement, we contribute to our customer in developing the end-user modules’ firmware, implementing new features, maintaining compatibility with the newest telecommunication and industry standards, as well as performing analysis and estimations of the customer requirements. Requirements: Skills and Knowledge Strong with numbers Analytically inclined Good Communication Skills Interpersonal skills – ability to interact with employees with empathy Basic understanding of Wage & salary administration activities Detail Oriented Strong Ethics and Discretion Job Responsibilities: Key Responsibilities Researching Compensation And Benefits Policies And Plans Ensuring compensation and benefits plans are cost-effective and competitive Evaluation Compensation Policies Administering the organization’s benefits programs (e.g., retirement plans, leave policies, wellness programs, insurance policies, etc.) Handle individual queries related to salary structure and benefits. Handle different audits time to time as per requirement. Handle salary restructuring of employees. Administration of the car lease and Loans policy Preparing analysis for compensation reviews Making recommendations based on data analyses Comparing benefits and compensation plans, job classifications, and salaries through data and cost analyses Designing reports and recommendations based on research and analysis for senior executive team Conduct the annual compensation market survey through external agencies and support data analysis. Review management reports/ presentations such as Attrition Analysis, Headcount, Wage Bill Report etc Manage all transactional aspects of the stock options policy in the company – issuance, documentation, forfeiture etc Ensuring compliance with local & state laws Works under the supervision of the Sr. Manager to develop and/or participate in compensation surveys to collect and analyze competitive salary information to determine the company’s competitive position. What We Offer Exciting Projects: We focus on industries like High-Tech, communication, media, healthcare, retail and telecom. Our customer list is full of fantastic global brands and leaders who love what we build for them. Collaborative Environment: You Can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment — or even abroad in one of our global centers or client facilities! Work-Life Balance: GlobalLogic prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules, opportunities to work from home, and paid time off and holidays. Professional Development: Our dedicated Learning & Development team regularly organizes Communication skills training(GL Vantage, Toast Master),Stress Management program, professional certifications, and technical and soft skill trainings. Excellent Benefits: We provide our employees with competitive salaries, family medical insurance, Group Term Life Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance , NPS(National Pension Scheme ), Periodic health awareness program, extended maternity leave, annual performance bonuses, and referral bonuses. Fun Perks: We want you to love where you work, which is why we host sports events, cultural activities, offer food on subsidies rates, Corporate parties. Our vibrant offices also include dedicated GL Zones, rooftop decks and GL Club where you can drink coffee or tea with your colleagues over a game of table and offer discounts for popular stores and restaurants! About GlobalLogic GlobalLogic is a leader in digital engineering. We help brands across the globe design and build innovative products, platforms, and digital experiences for the modern world. By integrating experience design, complex engineering, and data expertise—we help our clients imagine what’s possible, and accelerate their transition into tomorrow’s digital businesses. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, GlobalLogic operates design studios and engineering centers around the world, extending our deep expertise to customers in the automotive, communications, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, manufacturing, media and entertainment, semiconductor, and technology industries. GlobalLogic is a Hitachi Group Company operating under Hitachi, Ltd. (TSE: 6501) which contributes to a sustainable society with a higher quality of life by driving innovation through data and technology as the Social Innovation Business. Show more Show less

Nous recherchons un Tech Lead Java autonome et expérimenté pour piloter des équipes techniques sur une stack mêlant les dernières versions de Java et des exigences liées au cloud dans un environnement industrialisé Vous serez en charge de : Réaliser l'analyse et la conception technique détaillée des fonctionnalités Orienter les clients et l'équipe vers la solution technique la plus appropriée Réaliser le développement, les tests unitaires Réaliser les spécifications et la documentation technique Assurer le suivi de l’activité Etre un des référents techniques Intervention sur des projets en fonctionnement Agile En fil rouge : Transmettre les bonnes pratiques de développement à l'équipe Animer votre communauté en les sensibilisant à la veille, en présentant des thématiques et des ateliers/formations Coté management : Animer et motiver votre équipe par des actions de cohésion, du team building Suivre le développement professionnel et technique de votre équipe en menant les entretiens annuels, organisant la formation et en guidant les montées en compétence Exemple de projet : Effectuer la refonte de l’ensemble du SI d'un de nos clients grand compte afin de le recoder dans le cloud ! Vous interviendrez donc sur des projets à haute valeur ajoutée, dans un environnement dynamique, innovant et au sein d’équipes d'expertise. PROFIL De formation supérieure ou autodidacte, vous justifiez d'une expérience significative en développement Java et avec une expérience probante au poste de Tech Lead. Vous êtes orienté client, vous savez trouver la solution la plus efficiente, l'expliquer et la défendre pour le bon déroulement du projet. Vous maîtrisez les solutions de CI/CD. Une connaissance du cloud AWS est appréciée. SMILE est le leader du "sourire" au travail, mais aussi de l'intégration de solutions Open-Source. Enthousiastes, agiles et performants, notre vocation est de libérer le potentiel d'innovation des entreprises, à travers l'Open-Source ! Nos Smiliens experts accompagnent les entreprises dans des domaines aussi variés que le Digital, les Business Apps, l'Embarqué & l'IoT et l'Infrastructure : 2000 collaborateurs présents dans 9 pays , avec 17 agences réparties en France et à l'international. Nos marques expertes : SensioLabs, Neopixl, Alter Way, UX-Republic, Creativestyle et Synotis. Entreprise Handi-accueillante Show more Show less

Bienvenue chez Eviden, acteur clé du numérique de prochaine génération et leader mondial du cloud, du calcul avancé et de la sécurité ! Eviden opère dans tous les secteurs d’activité, et fait rayonner son expertise sur l’ensemble du continuum numérique. Nous rejoindre, c’est à la fois une opportunité exaltante de contribuer au futur de la tech et d’agir pour le bien commun, tout en bénéficiant d’un environnement équitable et inclusif, entouré d’experts de haut niveau ! Aujourd’hui, et pour les générations à venir, ouvrons le champ des possibles. Vous êtes curieux, inventif et audacieux ? Rejoignez la #TeamEviden ! Au sein de notre équipe Vertical AI en France, vous conseillerez nos clients sur le déploiement des technologies et des cas d'usage de l'IA. Nous avons développé un solide portefeuille de cas d'utilisation verticalisés pour différents domaines d'activité Fabrication & Industrie 4.0 Services financiers & Assurance Distribution & Marketing Santé & Sciences de la vie Grâce à vos compétences précises en matière de conseil et de données, vous accompagnerez nos clients dans leur parcours de transformation axé sur les données. Vous aurez à acculturer les clients sur DataMesh et sur la façon de construire des plateformes de données efficaces. Vous devrez également les accompagner dans la définition de leurs produits de données et les aider à résoudre certains problèmes de gouvernance de données entre les équipes métiers et informatiques. Vertical AI France est composé d'autres experts en IA localisés à Paris et Sophia Antipolis et travaillant en étroite collaboration avec notre récente acquisition Datasentics (leader européen des databricks) localisée en République Tchèque. Vos missions Acculturer notre client sur les données et le DataMesh Activités de Business Dev & Presales promouvoir notre portefeuille à travers des présentations, des démonstrations ou des défenses Mettre en œuvre des cas d'utilisation innovants Déployer et intégrer nos produits dans les environnements clients Compétences techniques Expertise DataMesh Architecture de données Ingénierie de données Certification Cloud Soft skills Orateur persuasif Maîtrise de l'anglais et du français Connaissance métier dans l'un de nos domaines Esprit agile et entrepreneurial Faire partie des pionniers d'Eviden, ça vous dit ? C'est justement cette audace et cette curiosité qu'on recherche chez nos talents pour grandir ensemble, transformer des possibilités en réalité pour nos clients et façonner le futur de la Tech et de la société. Chez Eviden, diversité, équité et inclusion sont au cœur de notre politique RH. Nos métiers sont tous ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap et ce, quelle que soit la nature de celui-ci. Grâce à nos programmes qui soutiennent toutes les diversités, nos collaborateurs et collaboratrices sont pleinement impliqués pour faire vivre cette culture de l’inclusion. Rejoignez notre communauté ! Show more Show less

job_summary: Who We Are At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse. Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work. There are almost 400 of us in VML Prague, and in the office, you'll meet both junior and senior colleagues from different parts of the world. We speak Czech and English, but sometimes you'll also hear Spanish, German, or Italian. Although we are the largest marketing agency in the Czech Republic and a bit of a corporate, an important part of our corporate culture is a friendly and informal atmosphere based on mutual trust and cooperation. We are expanding our team by adding a Digital Designer to strengthen our fantastic creative team for one of the agency's largest clients. We aim to find someone skilled in the craft, who also keeps a fresh mind brimming with new ideas. Someone who loves their work and consistently delivers high-quality results. Are you able to flawlessly follow guidelines while also being comfortable proposing your own solutions and ideas? If so, you're exactly the person we're looking for. What you will do? Designing digital communication elements, including newsletters, banners, website promotional spaces, product pages (microsites), social media content, informational sites, and e-shops. Adapting and customizing these digital communication elements for various purposes, formats, and localization from Czech to other languages, and vice versa. Collaborating with other designers, Art and Creative Directors, Copywriters, and, of course, the Account team. What you will need? Advanced Adobe Photoshop skills, including working with smart objects, vector shapes, paths, masks, libraries, basic adjustments, and minor image retouching. Intermediate Adobe Illustrator skills for icon and pictogram design, as well as object editing. At least two years of experience creating designs for commercial purposes, businesses, or corporations. Ability to handle a high volume of production with an organized approach. Experience applying elements and styles as defined in Brand Manuals and Guidelines. An eye for composition and foundational typography. Creative thinking and the ability to meet agreed deadlines. Basic familiarity with Figma and Adobe XD is advantageous, as we use these for importing/exporting assets-ideally, you have at least a working knowledge of these tools. Strong English skills (our team communicates exclusively in English). What reward will you get from us? Stability and the backing of a large agency with the atmosphere of a small one; Working in a senior team; An agency full of talented people, built on mutual respect and inspiration; Various educational activities to support development and growth, with maximum flexibility to meet individual needs; At least 27 days off and free entry to our RunTour running event; Offices in the WPP Campus at Bubenská 1, offering various events and conferences directly in the building, plus discounts in the surrounding area; Close collaboration with other WPP agencies, so when we need expertise, we don't have to go far; Meal allowance of CZK 99/day; Dog & baby friendly approach; To sum it up - at VML, we care not only about doing good work but especially about the people behind it. We want everyone here to feel like themselves. We welcome anyone who can further enrich our team with their mindset, personality, or energy. At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization-creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers-who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction. VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X. When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it. Show more Show less

Who You’ll Work With As a modern technology company, our Slalom Technologists are disrupting the market and bringing to life the art of the possible for our clients. We have passion for building strategies, solutions, and creative products to help our clients solve their most complex and interesting business problems. We surround our technologists with interesting challenges, innovative minds, and emerging technologies. Slalom Workday Consultants work in partnership with our clients to ensure maximum value out of their Workday investment. Workday consultants serve as subject matter experts in a variety of strategic and high-impact projects, guiding clients from strategic planning to implementation and sustainment. You will also support Workday customers at every stage of the lifecycle including early strategy and selection, implementation, and ensuring continued success after go-live. Our Workday Advisory capability partners with our clients to deliver Workday strategy and readiness, implementation support, and optimization and road mapping. What You’ll Do Participate in Workday integration technical design sessions and develop detailed technical solution documentation that is aligned with client business objectives Develop, test, and document Workday integrations across HCM, Payroll, Financials and other domains Collaborate with Workday functional team members to translate business requirements into integrated solutions across the Workday platform Educate clients on general Workday concepts including Business Process design, security, authentication and reporting Use common integration patterns and techniques to develop solutions that automate the flow of data to many downstream applications You will contribute to the development and expansion of new capabilities within the Workday Global practice and across Slalom 20% travel What You’ll Bring Experience developing application integration solutions using Workday Studio, Cloud Connectors, EIBs, RaaS reports and the Workday Public API with limited oversight High level of proficiency in XSLT, XML, JSON and Workday calculated fields is required Certification in Workday Integrations Core, Workday Studio and Workday Financials is required Desired certification and experience in one or more of the following: Workday Prism, Extend, CCTPP, Orchestration, Adaptive Insights Integrations, Workday reporting, BIRT Interest and general awareness of iPaaS technologies including MuleSoft, Boomi, and Informatica. Ability to partner with iPaaS developers to craft data movement solutions across platforms About Us Slalom is a purpose-led, global business and technology consulting company. From strategy to implementation, our approach is fiercely human. In six countries and 43 markets, we deeply understand our customers—and their customers—to deliver practical, end-to-end solutions that drive meaningful impact. Backed by close partnerships with over 400 leading technology providers, our 13,000+ strong team helps people and organizations dream bigger, move faster, and build better tomorrows for all. We’re honored to be consistently recognized as a great place to work, including being one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For seven years running. Learn more at slalom.com. Compensation And Benefits Slalom prides itself on helping team members thrive in their work and life. As a result, Slalom is proud to invest in benefits that include meaningful time off and paid holidays, parental leave, 401(k) with a match, a range of choices for highly subsidized health, dental, & vision coverage, adoption and fertility assistance, and short/long-term disability. We also offer yearly $350 reimbursement account for any well-being-related expenses, as well as discounted home, auto, and pet insurance. Slalom is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. For this position at the Consultant level the base salary pay range is $96,000 to $177,000. For this position at the Senior Consultant level the base salary pay range is $110,000 to $203,000. For this position at the Principal level the base salary pay range is $122,000 to $225,000. In addition, individuals may be eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. Actual compensation will depend upon an individual’s skills, experience, qualifications, location, and other relevant factors. The salary pay range is subject to change and may be modified at any time. EEO and Accommodations Slalom is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to inclusion, diversity, and equity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Slalom will also consider qualified applications with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Slalom welcomes and encourages applications from individuals with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available for candidates during all aspects of the selection process. Please advise the talent acquisition team if you require accommodations during the interview process. We will accept applications until January 31, 2025 #AK1 Show more Show less

Nous recherchons un(e) Architecte Cloud pour travailler au sein d’un Centre de Services déployé pour un ambitieux projet. Le client, acteur majeur dans son secteur, effectue la refonte de l’ensemble de son SI afin de le recoder dans le cloud. Vous interviendrez donc sur des projets à haute valeur ajoutée, dans un environnement dynamique, innovant et au sein d’équipes d'expertise. Vous prenez part à la conception du produit sur lequel vous travaillerez et suivez les phases du projet. Vous développez dans un environnement industrialisé et automatisé (CI/CD). Vos missions sont les suivantes : Définition de l’architecture Choix techniques sur le projet Développement des fonctionnalités complexes et critiques Identification des anomalies et correctifs Veille à l’optimisation de la performance et de la sécurité La stack : Infrastructure cloud : AWS, services GCP Langage Backend : Java 11 et 17 / Spring, Maven / Gradle, Liquibase / Flyaway, JUnit\Mockito Langage FrontEnd : Angular, html/css, Protractor, Karma-Jasmine Conteneurisation : Docker, Kubernetes CI/CD : Git, Gitlab Ops : Ansible, Terraform Base de données : Postgres, Elastic, Oracle Vous justifiez de 6 ans d’expérience minimum en Architecture cloud. Vous êtes en mesure d’expliquer vos choix et défendre vos positions auprès du client et des équipes de production. Vous avez une vision sur l’atterrissage technique du projet dont vous êtes l’expert Vous êtes dans une démarche design-to-cost pour votre client. Une expérience des projets en méthode Scrum est appréciée. SMILE est le leader du "sourire" au travail, mais aussi de l'intégration de solutions Open-Source. Enthousiastes, agiles et performants, notre vocation est de libérer le potentiel d'innovation des entreprises, à travers l'Open-Source ! Nos Smiliens experts accompagnent les entreprises dans des domaines aussi variés que le Digital, les Business Apps, l'Embarqué & l'IoT et l'Infrastructure : 2000 collaborateurs présents dans 9 pays , avec 17 agences réparties en France et à l'international. Nos marques expertes : SensioLabs, Neopixl, Alter Way, UX-Republic, Creativestyle et Synotis. Entreprise handi-accueillante. Show more Show less

Qui nous sommes. Nous sommes une équipe d’experts passionnés avec une ambition claire utiliser le numérique pour faire avancer ce qui compte pour nos clients et la société. Chaque jour, nous travaillons ensemble pour créer des fondations numériques fiables et évolutives pour les entreprises, les institutions et les communautés du monde entier. Plus d’informations sur Advancing what matters Dans le cadre dynamique de notre Inno’Lab à Caen, nous recherchons un Chef de Projet Innovation pour conduire et piloter nos projets d'innovation en partenariat avec nos clients. L’Inno’lab de Caen se distingue par son expertise en Machine Learning (ML), en IA générative et en Computer Vision. Nos champs d'application sont variés et captivants, allant du déploiement de solutions d'intelligence artificielle pour des acteurs majeurs de la santé, de l'industrie et des services, avec une forte orientation vers les technologies marines, l'expérience sensorielle, l'automatisation et la santé. Le poste en quelques mots En collaboration avec votre équipe, vous serez responsable de l'expansion et de la mise en œuvre efficace de ces projets chez nos clients. De manière simultanée, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans le développement de votre pipe delivery en travaillant avec l'équipe d'innovation pour promouvoir, valoriser et formaliser ces compétences. Ce que vous allez faire si vous nous rejoignez Collaborer étroitement avec le Directeur Régional de l’Innovation pour généraliser nos preuves de concept (POC) auprès de nos clients et prospects, et assurer leur mise à l’échelle une fois validées. Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes R&D de l’Inno’Lab et les équipes de réalisation de l’agence. Assurer la conformité et l'organisation des données dans les systèmes d'information. Superviser le cycle de vie de bout en bout d’un projet IA Organiser et participer aux AVV Environnement technique TensorFlow et PyTorch Maîtrise de Python et C++. La familiarité avec Git, Docker et Cuda serait un atout. Votre profil De formation BAC+5 dans le domaine informatique ou dans un domaine connexe. Vous possédez une solide expérience en gestion de projet. Expérience réussie dans les technologies de l'intelligence artificielle, notamment les réseaux de neurones, Maitrise de Python + Cloud. Maîtrise des développements logiciels associés (technologies, WEB Services, bases de données, intégration de modules spécifiques). Expérience de la conduite de projets en mode capacitaire et forfaitaire dans les environnements AI. Bonnes communication et capacité de présentation sur des sujets techniques et généraux Capacité de travail en équipe Maîtrise de l'anglais. Fourchette de salaire selon expérience 40k€ et 50k€ Nos conditions et programmes internes Possibilité de travailler de façon hybride (télétravail jusqu’à 3 jours par semaine) Tickets restaurant (valeur faciale de 10€, 60% pris en charge par l’employeur) Evénements d'intégration et autres événements internes Disponibilité de tous vos congés et RTT dès votre arrivée Programme de cooptation jusqu’à 2750 € de prime Accès aux activités sociales et culturelles Aide à la mobilité durable (vélo et covoiturage) Votre futur professionnel chez Atos Des opportunités de développement professionnel et d’évolution de carrière Plus de 600 formations certifiantes et plateforme e-learning Un accompagnement de proximité Prêt à vous lancer dans cette aventure passionnante avec nous ? Saisissez votre chance et postulez ! En savoir plus La diversité est un moteur au service de la créativité de nos clients, et nous nous efforçons chaque jour de créer un environnement où chacun se sent soutenu et encouragé. La « Tech for Good » s'inscrit au cœur de notre mission, que ce soit en matière de lutte contre le changement climatique, pour promouvoir l'inclusion numérique ou garantir la confiance dans la gestion des données. Nous sommes fiers des nombreuses reconnaissances mondiales pour nos pratiques environnementales, sociales et de gouvernance, et nous nous engageons à construire un avenir meilleur pour tous en exploitant le pouvoir de la technologie. job_summary: Qui nous sommes Nous sommes une équipe d’experts passionnés avec une ambition claire utiliser le numérique pour faire avancer ce qui compte pour nos clients et la société. Chaque jour, nous travaillons ensemble pour créer des fondations numériques fiables et évolutives pour les entreprises, les institutions et les communautés du monde entier. Plus d’informations sur Advancing what matters Le poste en quelques mots Dans notre entité Technology Services, nous proposons à nos clients locaux de les accompagner en assistance technique ou en engagement forfaitaire. Dans le cadre du développement de nos projets, nous recherchons un chef de projet qui prendra en charge le pilotage de projets avec engagement (Fortait et/ou TMA) Ce que vous allez faire si vous nous rejoignez Votre mission consistera à gérer un/des projets à engagement. A ce titre, vous assurez les responsabilité suivantes Être garant de la Road Map globale du/des projets confiés (Qualité, Planning, Budget) ; Assurer la coordination du projet vis-à-vis des différents acteurs (MOA, MOE, intégration et production) et gérer le suivi fonctionnel et technique tout au long du cycle de fabrication ; Piloter l’équipe de développement Mettre en place des plans d’action et gérer les risques et les alertes ; Piloter les comités projet et de pilotage ; Réaliser le suivi de l’avancement (Planning, tâches, Budget). Votre profil De formation supérieure, vous êtes titulaire d'un Bac+5 en informatique, et avez plus de 3 ans d’expérience en conduite de projet en société de services avec engagement (Forfait et/ou TMA). Afin d’assurer la fonction, vous disposez des qualités et compétences suivantes Une parfaite maîtrise de la conduite de projets au forfait Découpage en activités Estimation et valorisation des charges par activité, suivi du réalisé et réestimation des RAF Gouvernance des comités technique et de pilotage Production des indicateurs de suivi (projet, financier, risques) Gestion des risques, gestion des priorités et mise en place des plans d’actions Méthodes de pilotage associées (Itératives, Agiles, …), Une posture de responsable dans la gestion et le discours (écrit et oral) pour tenir les engagements vis-à-vis du client et en interne. Un bagage technique solide Fullstack (Angular, JEE, Spring, CI/CD, …). Un esprit d'équipe (savoir animer, écouter, cadrer et accompagner) En synthèse, vos compétences vous permettent d’être garant des engagements et de la satisfaction clients ainsi que de la rentabilité de vos projets. Vous êtes également à l’aise avec l’anglais professionnel. job_title: Stage/Apprentissage Consultant Junior Human Capital Management
job_summary: Job Description DXC Technology est un leader mondial des services IT qui aide ses clients à gérer leurs systèmes et à transformer leurs processus avec des solutions innovantes. Avec une présence dans plus de 70 pays, nous sommes engagés à fournir des résultats exceptionnels à nos clients en combinant expertise métier et expertise technologique. En intégrant notre activité en conseil RH et SIRH au sein de la practice Human Capital Management, vous intégrez une équipe de professionnels passionnés et contribuez à façonner l'avenir numérique de nos clients. Vous serez amenés à participer à des projets d’amélioration de la performance opérationnelle, de transformation (outils, organisation) ou de digitalisation des processus métiers RH. En tant que Stagiaire ou Apprenti, vous ferez partie intégrante de nos équipes en mission chez nos clients. Vous serez le lien entre les équipes métiers et les équipes techniques, garantissant la réussite des projets SIRH depuis la phase de conception jusqu'à la mise en production. Vos Principales Responsabilités Incluront Recueillir et analyser les besoins des utilisateurs métiers pour définir et rédiger cahiers des charges et spécifications fonctionnelles Planifier, coordonner et piloter les différentes phases des projets SIRH (suivi, risques, respect des délais etc.) Participer à la conception des solutions SIRH en collaboration avec les équipes techniques ou en réalisant l’intégration des solutions de nos partenaires Élaborer les plans de tests, organiser les phases de recette et valider la conformité de la solution aux exigences métiers Former les utilisateurs et les accompagner dans la prise en main des nouveaux outils Vous êtes : Etudiant en dernière année d'une grande école d'ingénieurs, de commerce, d’université en gestion des ressources humaines ou un domaine connexe et vous cherchez un stage de fin d’étude ou un apprentissage avec une opportunité d’embauche en CDI Curieux des nouvelles technologies avec un intérêt prononcé sur l’innovation et l’intelligence artificielle Capable de travailler de manière autonome et en équipe, avec un excellent sens de la communication et à évoluer dans des contextes internationaux, anglais indispensable à l’oral et à l’écrit. Ce Que Nous Vous Offrons Une opportunité d’intervenir sur des missions à forte valeur ajoutée auprès de grands clients en contextes internationaux Une montée en compétence rapide grâce à l’expérience unique de nos équipes et nos offres de formation Une gratification et des avantages attractifs (accès au CE, tickets restaurant, remboursement des frais de transport à hauteur de 50%) Notre Process De Recrutement Entretien avec le responsable des stages Entretiens avec les équipes dans le cadre d’une session de recrutement qui se déroule chaque mercredi matin Sessions d’Onboarding virtuelle et présentielle Rejoignez notre équipe, nos différences sont nos talents ! Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here . Show more Show less

You will be working in key projects for leading organizations in the strategy, commercial effectiveness, transformation: organization and processes, risk management and control and marketing, financial and management information areas. Requirements Recent graduates or final year students from disciplines relating to Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Actuarial Science or Engineering. A Master's degree qualification will be taken into account when determining salary conditions. Solid academic record. Get up and go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic. Knowledge of other languages is desirable. Postgraduate studies and/or specialised courses are an asset. Strong computer skills. Strong ability to learn quickly. Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams. We Offer The best environment to develop talent We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest: Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry, for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets, alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level, as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent in training 600 hours of training during the first two years. Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses. Last year our staff as a whole received over 375.000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses. Every new joiner is enrolled in our degree in Business Consulting Management Solutions-ICADE Business School, offering a specialization in Big data and Data Science for professionals with a technological or mathematical background. Clearly defined career plan Internal promotion based solely on merit. Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners. Description: JD Requirements: What you’ll do: – Triage issues coming from various channels such as phone, chat, or web portal – Prioritize customer urgency and issues priority – Search and reuse information gained from our internal information repositories – Log all incidents and requests into our case management system – Accurately document all customer interactions in a case management system – Create positive experiences through effective and clear communication – Excellent Communication Skills, Written and oral . – Appropriate sense of urgency and respect for our customers’ time and effort What you’ll need to succeed: – Ability to assess customer sentiment at all stages during the communication. – Ability to drive issues through the organization with urgency. – Ability to communicate verbally or in writing with the appropriate etiquette, timeliness, and professionalism. – Ability to understand the business impact of issues. – Ability to stay calm under stressful conditions while driving issues Job Responsibilities: – Triage issues coming from various channels such as phone, chat, or web portal. – Prioritize customer urgency and issue priority. – Search and reuse information gained from Adobe internal information repositories. – Log all incidents and requests into the Adobe case management system. – Accurately document all customer interactions in a case management system. – Connect issues and cases to the most appropriate and effective resource. – Create positive experiences through effective and clear communications, appropriate sense of urgency, and respect for our customers’ time and effort. What We Offer Exciting Projects: We focus on industries like High-Tech, communication, media, healthcare, retail and telecom. Our customer list is full of fantastic global brands and leaders who love what we build for them. Collaborative Environment: You Can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment — or even abroad in one of our global centers or client facilities! Work-Life Balance: GlobalLogic prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules, opportunities to work from home, and paid time off and holidays. Professional Development: Our dedicated Learning & Development team regularly organizes Communication skills training(GL Vantage, Toast Master),Stress Management program, professional certifications, and technical and soft skill trainings. Excellent Benefits: We provide our employees with competitive salaries, family medical insurance, Group Term Life Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance , NPS(National Pension Scheme ), Periodic health awareness program, extended maternity leave, annual performance bonuses, and referral bonuses. Fun Perks: We want you to love where you work, which is why we host sports events, cultural activities, offer food on subsidies rates, Corporate parties. Our vibrant offices also include dedicated GL Zones, rooftop decks and GL Club where you can drink coffee or tea with your colleagues over a game of table and offer discounts for popular stores and restaurants! About GlobalLogic GlobalLogic is a leader in digital engineering. We help brands across the globe design and build innovative products, platforms, and digital experiences for the modern world. By integrating experience design, complex engineering, and data expertise—we help our clients imagine what’s possible, and accelerate their transition into tomorrow’s digital businesses. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, GlobalLogic operates design studios and engineering centers around the world, extending our deep expertise to customers in the automotive, communications, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, manufacturing, media and entertainment, semiconductor, and technology industries. GlobalLogic is a Hitachi Group Company operating under Hitachi, Ltd. (TSE: 6501) which contributes to a sustainable society with a higher quality of life by driving innovation through data and technology as the Social Innovation Business. Show more Show less

Eviden is an Atos Group business with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion and a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 55,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come. Atos is a european leader in High Performance Computing, AI, Cybersecurity and Quantum Computing and delivers high performance solutions among the most successful in the world to solve the most complex scientific problems of today and tomorrow. Quantum computing is the next big technological revolution. Atos participates in this race for quantum computing and develops the Quantum Learning Machine (QLM) , the most powerful of the quantum computer simulation many prestigious research centers, public or private, already use it all over the world. To participate in this adventure we are looking for the best talents to strengthen our Quantum R&D team based in Clayes-sous-Bois, near Paris. We are recruiting a Software Engineer to join our team of engineers and high-level researchers with the challenge of participates to the software developments of the QLM product. Your profile With a higher education in IT, you have a minimum of 2 years of experience in software development functions A PhD degree is highly appreciated, but not mandatory. Proven skills in designing and developing scientific software in python and C++ Solid background in maths Basic knowledge of quantum computing Fluent English required. The positions are located in Paris' region (France) Let’s grow together. Show more Show less

MAIN MISSIONS Reporting to the Supply Planning Platform and Transformation Director, the Master Data Manager plays a major role in the management and transformation of the Group's data. He/she guarantees data integrity and ensures that the Group's needs are met throughout the value chain. As such, he/she will, within the Supply Planning Platform & Transformation entity to which he/she belongs, for example : Lead the management of data (customers, finished products and other coded items, suppliers) in the repositories via a team of 5 people, 70 to 90 local relays (BUs and plants), 1,000 contributors and data owners Define internal and external policies, standards and rules related to the management of the Group's data, and establish action plans to guarantee data integrity and compliance, while preventing risks (fraud, customer expectations) and conflicts of interest (management of waivers) Ensure continuous improvement: data cleansing, cross-checking, hierarchies, and linking the database to systems Model and extract data to ensure collection and reorganization to provide visibility across the value chain: from insights to values; Big Data approach BPO role for master data management: evolution of management tools and workflows (internal and external), definition of standards and procedures, assessment and development of skills Recommend/manage projects and changes within the organization (shared service centers between clusters) and item life cycle management processes PROFIL You have worked in an international environment and are fluent in both spoken and written English. A 5-year degree in Supply Chain from a business or engineering school, with at least 5 years' experience. You have significant experience in Supply Chain (planning or customer relations) or in finance. You are proactive and autonomous, with a strong sense of teamwork. You have an analytical and synthesizing mind You enjoy working in a multicultural environment You have an eye for detail, understanding of business needs, and problem-solving communication skills. Excellent communication and leadership skills You have skills in project management, change management, cross-functional management and risk management. You have a strong digital culture You have influence and the ability to create and maintain a network. Technical Skills Required Excellent communication skills in English (oral and written) required Analytical, technical and IT skills, with good experience of mathematics, technology, business intelligence, data mining or statistics. Job Description: Role Overview We are currently looking for a highly customer-focused and enthusiastic Mobile Support Engineer, with a genuine interest in solving IT issues, to support our Clients across various locations in Ireland. The successful candidate should be technically competent, possess good communication skills, be ready to learn, & thrive in a fast-paced regulated environment. The successful candidate will support desktops and connected devices in office areas, as well as support various pieces of infrastructure including network printers, & network hardware & server hardware in a Hands & Eyes manner. Job Description Working on behalf of DXC Providing wide ranging Deskside support to end users in office environments Work to resolve issues accurately and efficiently, within set targets and in a professional manner Maintain a dedicated commitment to service quality & customer experience Take ownership of tickets escalated from the service desk & other teams, handling them appropriately Work comfortably on your own, identifying, and prioritising incidents, requests, & escalations accordingly Work well within the client environment Ensure that all activity is accurately documented and recorded in line with ITIL practises Contribute to the creation and up-keep of Knowledge Base Articles Be comfortable working in a highly regulated environment, adhering to local and global policies Work healthily and safely, in accordance with DXC training and policies Adhere to all IT Asset Management procedures & policies Build and deploy PCs, patch network points, troubleshoot printer problems, support standard software packages, and other general “IT” tasks Be prepared to engage with ad-hoc tasks with a best effort and positive attitude Work comfortably in comms areas and data centres, providing ‘Hands and Eyes’ support to other teams as well as taking ownership and providing on-the-ground feedback and guidance to offshore teams Be ready and willing to learn new skills and procedures, growing and provide greater support for colleagues and clients Willingness to travel to other supported sites in the area to provide cover for colleagues when required Experience/Skills Ready to learn and face new challenges Excellent English written and verbal communication skills Ability to work independently and as part of a small team Ability to work well with global teams Experience of working in Desktop support role (3yrs+) Tested software and hardware troubleshooting skills Experience of supporting Windows 10 Experience supporting legacy Windows operating systems Experience of supporting Microsoft Office suites including Office 365 Experiencing working in a highly regulated / ITIL environment, with appropriate service / ticketing systems Proficiency with Network Infrastructure e.g., switches, routers, APs, patching, network architecture knowledge Server Hardware support experiencing (racking & providing Hands & Eyes support) Printer hardware knowledge Willingness to support essential out of hours work when required ITIL knowledge Full Clean Driving License & own vehicle, to be used for business Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf.
