Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på snabb implementering av affärssystem som SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med över 20 års erfarenhet hjälper vi svenska och internationella företag att skapa effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser. Vi har kontor på 10 orter i Sverige, 220 medarbetare, och omsätter 350 MSEK. Analytics Consultant SAP Implema växer och söker fler erfarna konsulter inom SAP Analytics! Vill du jobba i kundnära team med digitalisering och modern teknik? Då kan den här rollen vara rätt för dig! Vi söker nya kollegor till samtliga kontor från Umeå i norr till Malmö i söder, så det finns möjlighet till valfri placering och givetvis möjlighet att jobba hemifrån. Som konsult inom SAP Analytics är ditt uppdrag att bidra med kunskap och färdigheter för att våra kunder bättre ska förstå sin verksamhet. På Implema använder vi den senaste tekniken inom planering, simulering och affärsanalys, vilket är helt avgörande för att mäta och styra verksamheter till framgång. Samtidigt tycker vi att både vi och kunden utvecklas bäst om vi jobbar tillsammans. Du kommer få möjlighet att jobba med såväl seniora som juniora kollegor inom analytics och SAP applications. Som senior konsult är ditt uppdrag också att vara drivande i ett eller flera områden. Vårt unika arbetssätt Vi presenterar stolt Implema Way! Vårt arbetssätt vägleder kunderna steg för steg mot insikter, lösningar och kontinuerlig utveckling – och allt detta i en tidseffektiv process. Kärnan i metodiken är att snabbt, tryggt och kostnadseffektivt skapa en stabil och kraftfull plattform för att sedan stegvis utveckla och växa agilt med korta, snabba cykler. Påverkan på den befintliga verksamheten minimeras och varje utvecklingssteg hålls på en nivå som säkrar tidplan, budget och kvalitet. Den stegvisa utvecklingen medför att investeringsbeslut tas först när kunden har bättre insikt i vad som behövs i kommande steg. Med korta tidplaner elimineras slöseri av både tid och resurser. Vi bidrar till snabbare utveckling och hjälper kunden att framtidssäkra sin affär på ett mer lönsamt och hållbart sätt. Vi tror på att moderna affärssystem har enormt mycket funktionalitet redan i sitt standardutförande, och vi nyttjar det! Genom att undvika anpassningar och istället prioritera standards och best practices blir det enklare, snabbare och billigare att växa och utveckla affärsprocesserna över tid. Vårt fokus på standardsprocesser är också en förutsättning för många best-of-breed lösningar, tredjeparts-appar och för en snabb och effektiv digitalisering. Är du vår nya kollega? För att lyckas i rollen krävs minst 5 års erfarenhet inom SAP Analytics, exempelvis klassisk BW, BW4, planering, SAC, DWC samt Datasphere. Erfarenhet inom andra plattformar, såsom Qlik, kan också anses vara relevant Du kanske har jobbat som konsult eller på verksamhets-/kundsidan där du har skaffat dig praktisk erfarenhet av SAP Analytics Du är flytande i svenska och engelska (tal och skrift) För att trivas i rollen har du stort intresse för området och hur detta kan bidra till att stärka våra kunders konkurrenskraft. Du uppskattar att jobba nära beslutsfattare och har förmåga att få saker att hända. Du är också en dedikerad lagspelare som värnar om högkvalitativa leveranser. Vad du bidrar med till teamet Vi anpassar rollen efter dina unika färdigheter och kompetenser. Du har möjligheten att enbart fokusera på konsultrollen eller kombinera den med andra ansvarsområden. Det kan till exempel vara inom utbildning/mentorskap kopplat till vårt traineeprogram, projektledning, teamlead, eller stötta i våra presales-processer. Du bestämmer också om du helst fokuserar på support av befintliga kunder eller är med och leder arbetet i våra Analytics-projekt. Exempel på arbetsuppgifter: Implementering av SAP Analytics-lösningar Workshopfacilitering för kunder och kollegor Support och rådgivning till befintliga kunder vid frågor, fel och vidareutveckling Aktivt följa SAP:s utveckling av Analytics-produkter Implema erbjuder dig Välkommen till vår dynamiska organisation, där vår kultur präglas av stolthet, engagemang och stark vilja att alltid utvecklas. Vi lovar dig en utmanande och varierande roll där du har möjlighet att både växa och vara med och påverka. Om du, precis som vi, är nyfiken på ny teknik och uppskattar att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som ligger i absolut framkant så kommer du att trivas hos oss! Arbetsglädje, kreativitet och personlig utveckling börjar med god hälsa och att du mår bra. Därför eftersträvar vi att tillsammans med dig säkerställa en hållbar work-life balance i din tillvaro. För oss är det minst lika viktigt som att erbjuda alla våra anställda jobb i en god, hållbar arbetsmiljö med marknadsmässiga löner och förmåner. Välkommen med din ansökan! All extern hjälp med rekrytering undanbedes. Show more Show less

About Us: SentinelOne is defining the future of cybersecurity through our XDR platform that automatically prevents, detects, and responds to threats in real-time. Singularity XDR ingests data and leverages our patented AI models to deliver autonomous protection. With SentinelOne, organizations gain full transparency into everything happening across the network at machine speed – to defeat every attack, at every stage of the threat lifecycle. We are a values-driven team where names are known, results are rewarded, and friendships are formed. Trust, accountability, relentlessness, ingenuity, and OneSentinel define the pillars of our collaborative and unified global culture. We're looking for people that will drive team success and collaboration across SentinelOne. If you’re enthusiastic about innovative approaches to problem-solving, we would love to speak with you about joining our team! Who are we looking for? SentinelOne is looking for an experienced Copywriter to join our Brand Marketing team. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with outstanding creative and communication skills. As a Brand team member, the copywriter will create content for various projects pertaining to our website, working closely with the greater marketing team to bring multiple web-focused projects to life. The most successful candidate will have experience writing product and brand copy for the websites and can translate technical concepts into clear, concise, and engaging messaging. What will you do? Create, optimize, and update website content with a focus on SEO, ensuring it aligns with SentinelOne's brand voice and tone. Collaborate closely with the marketing and product teams to accurately communicate the benefits of our offerings and translate complex cybersecurity concepts into accessible and engaging language. Ensure consistency in style and tone across all web content, adhering to established brand voice guidelines. Work with designers to produce visually appealing web content that complements written messaging. Utilize AI-driven tools to streamline content creation and update processes, enhancing content scalability and efficiency. Stay informed about the latest AI content generation tools, algorithm updates, and best practices, incorporating them into content strategies. Conduct keyword research and implement on-page SEO strategies to improve website visibility and rankings. Review and refine content produced by other team members or external contributors, ensuring high quality and adherence to SEO standards. Manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment. What skills and knowledge should you bring? Bachelor's degree in Marketing, English, Journalism, or a related field. Proven experience as a content writer or web content specialist, with a strong portfolio showcasing B2B or SaaS-focused web content. Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with a keen eye for detail. Extensive experience in crafting web content, particularly for corporate SaaS and B2B audiences Familiarity with AI tools and their application in content creation and optimization. Knowledge of cybersecurity is a significant advantage. Ability to manage multiple projects and work independently, demonstrating ownership from start to finish. Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively communicate and work with cross-functional teams. Experience with content management systems (CMS), project management tools, and design software is a plus Why SentinelOne? You will be joining a cutting-edge company where you will tackle extraordinary challenges and work with the very best in the industry! Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Commuter, Health, and Dependent FSA Unlimited PTO Industry-leading gender-neutral parental leave Paid Company Holidays Paid Sick Time Employee stock purchase program Disability and life insurance Employee assistance program Gym membership reimbursement Cell phone reimbursement Numerous company-sponsored events, including regular happy hours and team-building events This U.S. role has a base pay range that will vary based on the location of the candidate. For some locations, a different pay range may apply. If so, this range will be provided to you during the recruiting process. You can also reach out to the recruiter with any questions. Base Salary Range $116,000—$160,000 USD SentinelOne is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. SentinelOne participates in the E-Verify Program for all U.S. based roles. Show more Show less

En savoir plus Soyez vous-même. Devenez qui vous voulez. Acteur mondial de l’ingénierie, de la technologie et du conseil, Expleo accompagne des entreprises reconnues dans leur innovation afin d’accélérer leur réussite. Nous nous appuyons sur plus de 40 ans d’expérience dans le développement de produits complexes, l’optimisation des processus de fabrication et la performance des systèmes d’information . Notre expérience sectorielle nous permet d’apporter à nos clients une expertise approfondie propre à stimuler l’innovation à chaque étape de la chaîne de valeur. Le groupe réalise un chiffre d’affaires annuel de plus d’un milliard d’euros. Expleo est un groupe responsable qui s’engage à placer l’éthique et la diversité au centre de ses pratiques, ainsi qu’à œuvrer pour une société plus durable et plus sûre . Chez Expleo , épanouissez-vous au cœur d’une communauté de 19 000 collaborateurs hautement qualifiés qui fournissent des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée dans 30 pays . A compétences égales, une attention particulière sera accordée aux candidatures des travailleurs handicapés et autres bénéficiaires de l'obligation d'emploi de l'article L. 5212-2 du code du travail. » Intégré à nos équipes, vous réaliserez diverses missions de conseil et d’accompagnement auprès de nos clients. Pourquoi nous rejoindre ? Un accompagnement technique sur le terrain Des formations continues via nos experts techniques Des valeurs humaines entre nos collaborateurs La diversité de nos équipes Une montée en compétences tout au long de sa carrière Travailler sur des projets de grandes ampleurs Préparateur Méthodes Assemblage H/F Où se situe le projet ? Vitrolles (13) Votre rôle dans ce projet : Vous interviendrez sur le site notre client, plus précisément sur le périmètre industrialisation et du support aux lignes d’assemblage. Au quotidien ? Validation de la faisabilité technique. Création des gammes de montage (DELMIA, WIPLINK, SAP). Rédaction des documents de travail (FT, SOI, JES). Validation 1 ers montages, mise à jour gamme et documentation. Support production (ergonomie, séquencement assemblage, points bloquants) Animation des services intervenants (BE, qualité, service outillage, …) Qui êtes-vous ? De formation BAC+2 ou BAC+3, vous avez une expérience significative de deux ans minimums sur un poste similaire. Vos qualités ? Autonome, minutieux(e) vous possédez un e xcellent esprit d'analyse et êtes réactif(ve). De bonnes capacités de rédaction ainsi que le goût pour le travail en équipe et le terrain seront des atouts indéniables. Vous êtes agile et polyvalent(e) sur les missions qui seront proposées. Vos compétences ? Vous disposez d'un bon niveau d'anglais. Vous avez une connaissance des milieux de productions ou industriels (matériaux dans le domaine chaudronnerie et/ou tôlerie), vous savez lire des document technique (plan, nomenclature, fiche technique, norme…). Vous savez créer des gammes et des nomenclatures. Vous avez des connaissances sur le logiciel SAP et à minima des notions sur les logiciels CATIA et DELMIA. Des connaissances dans le milieu aéronautique est un plus. Quels sont nos avantages ? Politique interne sur le télétravail CSE 13 RTT Tickets restaurant Prévoyance Santé Compte Epargne temps Prime de vacances Prime de cooptation Salaire à partir de 27K€ suivant votre expertise Quel est notre process de recrutement ? Vous êtes contacté dans un premier temps par un spécialiste du recrutement lors d’un échange téléphonique. À la suite de cela, nous organisons un entretien à la fois technique et RH. Une décision peut être prise dès cet entretien pour une embauche . Quoi qu’il arrive, vous aurez un retour de notre part. Vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur nos activités ? Expleo.com La localisation des postes n’est qu’indicative, une mobilité géographique sur le territoire national peut être requise si la mission client le nécessite ou si une nouvelle mission est proposée . A bientôt dans nos équipes ! 😊 Show more Show less

Introduction In this role, you'll work in one of our IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers (Delivery Centers), where we deliver deep technical and industry expertise to a wide range of public and private sector clients around the world. Our delivery centers offer our clients locally based skills and technical expertise to drive innovation and adoption of new technology. As an Application Developer, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact! Your Role and Responsibilities Solution using multiple technologies to address functional needs, and convert design to functional and technical specifications. Provides and/or oversees business application functional support services to meet customer performance, availability, service level agreements and customer satisfaction targets. Ensures adherence to project management, software application development, testing, service management, change management, RCA and other relevant processes, standards, governance and controls Plan and manage medium to large scale, complex, integrated application or platform projects to ensure effective and efficient execution in line with guardrails of scope, timeline, budget and quality. Help defining coding best practices within team. Perform design reviews Required Technical and Professional Expertise Java 8 and above, Spring boot, REST API Design and development, Spring cloud, Spring Data/JPA/Hibernate, Database (SQL server/DB2), Docker, Container orchestration (Open Shift / Kubernetes), Messaging (Rabbit MQ / Kafka knowledge), CI/CD (Azure DevOps / Drone.io) & Monitoring & Alerting (AppDynamics / Prometheus) Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise ELK stack, Grafana & AWS About Business Unit IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet. Your Life @ IBM In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better. Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background. Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do. Are you ready to be an IBMer? About IBM IBM's greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world. Our recruiters advise that you apply to not more than 3 roles in a year for the best candidate experience. For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application. Being You @ IBM IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Requisition #1756 Senior Systems Engineer Join the Winning Netwrix Team! About Us: We are a rapidly growing IT company of dedicated professionals striving to make a difference in the world of data security. Organizations of all sizes rely on our products to protect their business-critical data and personal information of their customers and employees from cyber-attacks and data breaches With 15 years of experience in the field, Netwrix continues its market expansion via innovation and acquisitions (Stealthbits, NNT, Anixis, Strongpoint, PolicyPak, UserCube, CoSoSys and PingCastle). Now the company is backed up by the leading private equity firm TA Associates. Netwrix is headquartered in Irvine, California, and has regional offices in the U.S., the UK, and the Czech Republic. Due to the pandemic, we have all moved to home offices, and have remained remote ever since. We are looking for a highly motivated, positive, and organized individual to join our Professional Services team as a Senior Systems Engineer . Are you an energetic and ambitious individual ready to get your career on the fast-track in a high-growth tech environment? Working for Netwrix, you will have an opportunity to make immediate business impacts while accelerating your personal career development, surrounded by a positive and motivating team. What You Will Do: Implementation is where visions become reality and software becomes a solution. The Professional Services team has the privilege and critical opportunity to cement relationships with new customers and build on relationships for those customers who’ve expanded their software investment with us. The Senior Systems Engineer is responsible for working with Netwrix’s customers to implement Netwrix’s award-winning software in their environments. A person in this role: Acquires, maintains, and expands subject matter expertise in Netwrix’s software and the broad array of platforms it helps to protect. Embodies Netwrix’s values as an ambassador to Netwrix’s customers and prospects, and ensures a successful delivery project leveraging Netwrix’s Deployment Methodology. Acts as a trusted advisor to Netwrix’s customers, working with client, channel partner, and internal stakeholders as necessary to identify & understand technical and security problems facing them, and offers solutions for how to tackle them using Netwrix’s growing portfolio of software solutions. Works on projects of different sizes and complexities in parallel, some as part of a 2-3 person delivery team and others with relative autonomy. Keeps project stakeholders proactively informed of agendas, progress, and outcomes. Works as an extension of our technical support team, as necessary. Values organization, is team-oriented and self-motivated, with a positive attitude and ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks based on deadlines and urgency/impact Is energized by the challenge of planning, designing, building, executing, and perform knowledge transfer on custom reports, workflows, and integrations that enhance the value of the software for Netwrix’s customers Provides constructive feedback to the Netwrix product team in the form of feature suggestions to improve end user experience, qualified problem tickets related to issues encountered in the field, and feedback on internal preview releases during training and other retrospective opportunities. You are a strong fit for this role if you have: B.A./B.S. degree or higher or equivalent industry experience A minimum of two years of experience supporting and/or implementing software applications Strong knowledge of Windows Operating Systems and Active Directory Strong analytical and problem solving skills Experience with logic/scripting/programming, especially Knowledge of database concepts or database administration (esp. MS SQL Server) and proficiency with T-SQL Proficiency with PowerShell, Python, or similar Experience with REST APIs Working knowledge of SharePoint, File Systems, LDAP-based directories, network protocols, cloud-based applications (esp. those offered in Microsoft 365 Suite) Experience working with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, and Google Workspace Experience working with PAM solutions. Additional Positive Criteria: Familiarity with basic change control concepts and appreciation for technical documentation Privacy and security enthusiast, having basic familiarity with data protection regulations like EU GDPR and CCPA Experience with Antivirus/Antimalware tools Understanding of UNIX/Linux platforms Experience with analysis tools such as PowerBI and Tableau Experience with virtualization software (VMWare, Hyper-V, etc.) Experience with web development & administration Helpful/Common Certifications (not required and not specifically endorsed by Netwrix) MCSA CompTIA A+, Security+, Server+, Project+, Cybersecurity+ CISSP CISM PMP Why You’ll Love Working at Netwrix: Unlimited PTO Excellent Health Benefits Paid Parental Leave Wellness Programs (walking challenges, virtual yoga classes, and virtual stretching exercises) On the Go Training Sessions on Topics that Matter Team Orientated and Collaborative Colleagues Casual and Innovative Work Environment Opportunities for Career Advancement Regular Town Halls to Keep You Informed All Told…We have a culture that truly cares about our Employees, and we rely on their voice to help us thrive! We welcome people across all different backgrounds and experiences and look forward to hearing from you! Netwrix is an Equal Opportunity Employer Show more Show less

job_title: Salgskonsulenter på deltid til Telenors butikker
job_location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
job_summary: Med en stilling som salgskonsulent hos os får du tillært færdigheder du kan bruge i mange andre henseender. Formidlings-, argumentations- og forhandlingsteknik er egenskaber, der ikke begrænser sig til salgsfaget. Med en stilling som salgskonsulent hos Telenor på dit CV står du professionelt godt efter endt uddannelse. I Telenor søger vi løbende nye kolleger til vores butikker på tværs af hele landet. Når du søger stillingen som salgskonsulent hos os, vælger du blot på listen, hvilke byer det er relevant for dig at komme i betragtning til. Så kontakter vi dig! Selvstændig, ejendomsmægler, forsvarsadvokat eller bare hundredemetermester i at gå til eksamen? Et studiejob i Telenor Retail giver dig færdigheder du kan bruge i mange sammenhænge. Vi kan kickstarte din salgskarriere i vores veludviklede træningskultur, der har fokus på, at du hele tiden bliver en lille smule bedre, end du var i går. Men selv hvis du ikke umiddelbart tænker at gøre langsigtet karriere inden for salg, giver jobbet dig færdigheder, der styrker dig inden for alle former for kommunikation. Uanset hvad du aspirerer efter i fremtiden, vil de personlige egenskaber som selvsikkerhed samt faglige egenskaber som formidlings- og argumentationsteknik gøre dine præstationer til eksamen misundelsesværdige. Vores kunder behandles som hos Bedste Vores kunder er vores levebrød. I jobbet som salgskonsulent bliver din fornemmeste opgave at behandle vores kunder, som gæster i dit eget hjem. Med produkter, der skiller sig fra konkurrenternes, finder du den helt rigtige løsning for vores kunder, der giver dem sikkerhed, tryghed og frihed i deres digitale liv. Du bliver ansigtet udadtil, og derfor forventer vi en professionelle fremtoning - men vi er helt sikre på, at den blå skjorte vil stå knivskarpt til dine øjne. Hvem har vi brug for? Det er lige meget, om du aldrig har solgt før, eller slet ikke er teknisk savvy. Alt det skal vi nok lære dig. Det vigtigste er din energi, dit engagement, og din attitude. Vi søger en ny kollega der Er kæmpe fortaler for den fælles teamindsats – her samarbejder vi om at nå vores salgsmål Er motiveret af at lære nyt Har mulighed for at arbejde om eftermiddagen/aften samt hver anden weekend Til gengæld får du Løn efter gældende overenskomst med mulighed for bonus Et telefonnummer du kan bruge både på arbejde og hjemme Uovertrufne kollegaer, du kommer til at betegne som venner Alt det, der står ovenover En arbejdsplads fyldt med Fantastiske forbindelser Som arbejdsplads har vi fokus på at skabe Fantastiske forbindelser imellem hinanden og vores kunder. Med de nyeste løsninger og det mest effektive netværk skaber vi små mirakler i en verden, der aldrig står stille. I en stilling som salgskonsulent bliver du en del af teamet i den butik du ansættes i. I hver butik er der typisk 5-7 andre medarbejdere, udover butikschefen. Butikschefen vil blive din nærmeste leder, der, sammen med dig, sikrer den rigtige udvikling for dig. Som deltidsmedarbejder i en af Telenors butikker er arbejdstiden 8 t/u, der typisk ligger som eftermiddags- og weekendarbejde. Du får løn efter overenskomst, og med mulighed for kvartalsvis bonus. Søg i dag! Lad være med at bruge tid på at skrive en ansøgning, det er ikke vigtigt for os. Bare klik på linket, øverst i annoncen, udfyld oplysningerne og besvar spørgsmålene om jobbet vi stiller dig, så vi har en idé om, hvorfor ovenstående taler til dig. Det er også her du vælger, hvilke byer det er relevant for dig at komme i betragtning til et job i. Af GDPR-mæssige årsager modtager vi kke ansøgninger på mail. Vi glæder os til at høre mere om dig! WHY DEPT®? We are pioneers at heart. What this means, is that we are always leaning forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating. Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 20+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients' problems, no matter where you are in the world. This is remote role, however you must be located within 50 miles of Los Angeles, CA to be considered. About You Our Programmatic Managers are our resident experts in programmatic and direct buying; negotiating direct deals, building stellar full funnel media plans, and optimizing with complete precision. They are responsible for keeping on top of industry-wide trends, developments, and best practices and putting them to optimal use for each client’s programmatic and/or direct buy initiatives. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team that includes activation (Paid Search and Paid Social), Ad Operations, Integrated Planning, Client Partners, and Data Strategy; all working to make sure client needs are anticipated and met. As a Manager, Programmatic, you will be responsible for the following key areas: 1) design and execution of programmatic and/or direct buy tactical strategy 2) act as a subject matter expert in programmatic and direct buys for your assigned clients by answering client communication and leading weekly calls 3) project management accounts you own. PROFICIENCY EXPECTATIONS We expect Managers to have a solid foundation of programmatic and direct buy account management skills, from tactical strategy to execution, and proven analytical and problem-solving skills. We expect the proficiencies listed below: Delivering tactical programmatic and/or direct buy strategy geared towards achieving or exceeding client efficiency and growth Account management and completion of campaign builds and optimization in DSPs within agreed upon timelines Accountability for monitoring campaigns and pacing daily to ensure delivery of budgets and KPI targets Collaborating on roadmaps, testing plans, reporting dashboards, and QBRs/FBRs to meet client needs and goals Ability to quantify and prioritize initiatives that will have greatest impact on account performance while balancing long term growth initiatives Implementing testing initiatives in key areas such as creative, audience segmentation, placement, format, publisher, and ad tech partner negotiation/selection Ensuring all account programmatic management efforts go through a QA process and are executed/delivered error free Supporting Client Partners with account communications, recommendations, slides, and tactical plans for programmatic and direct buys, ensuring a clear, consistent, and strategic vision is set for clients Following SME’s and consistently attending DEPT®’s training opportunities to stay up to date on agency POVs, thought leadership, industry trends, partnership capabilities. Continuously expanding knowledge of programmatic and direct buy best practices. Collaborating with internal teams across clients businesses (Paid Social, Paid Search, SEO/CRO, Planning/Strategy, Data Strategy, etc.) to deliver upon clients goals. GROWTH EXPECTATIONS Over time in the role, we expect Managers to be responsible for learning and understanding higher-level concepts as below: Active delegation, coaching, and mentorship to Associates & Sr Associates Understand the business model and objectives of their client’s businesses and how programmatic and direct buys play a key role in each stage of the funnel Contribute to agency thought leadership and case studies Effective management of a direct report through skill development, guiding growth opportunities, and consistent support around employee work-life balance and morale. Qualifications Advanced understanding of programmatic and direct buys, keenly understanding how they fit within the a full funnel strategy A minimum of 4 years’ experience in programmatic advertising and a minimum 1 year of experience in a client-facing digital marketing role 2 years’ experience trading in DV360 and/or The Trade Desk Comfort and proficiency in utilizing pivot tables and VLOOKUP function in Excel and/or Google Sheets for reporting and data analysis for insights Proven prior work experience presenting findings and making recommendations for account optimizations to internal stakeholders or external clients Experience establishing relationships and working directly with publishers, SSPs, data, and/or adtech partners Strong written and verbal communication skills What Impresses Us A Google Analytics certification Experience in managing programmatic campaigns in Google Ads (GDA and YouTube) and Amazon DSP Energetic, passionate, and creative programmatic enthusiast; eager to roll up your sleeves and be hands on and learn Enthusiasm to grow in programmatic, embodying a “forever student” mentality Entrepreneurial spirited and a self-starter; able to work both independently and in a team environment WHAT DO WE OFFER? We are a collaborative, open-door, best-idea-wins environment that fosters personal and company growth and has fun doing it. Here is a snapshot of our benefits package: Healthcare, Dental, and Vision coverage 401k plan, plus matching PTO Paid Company Holidays Parental Leave The anticipated salary range for this position is $74,300 - $90,000. Salary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, expertise, physical location, and organizational impact. This is based on a 40-hour workweek and leveling. Keep in mind, we're flexible. WE SUPPORT YOU BEING YOU: DEPT® is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). We believe our work is its best when our people feel safe and free to be themselves. We’re committed to an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace, regardless of anyone’s lived experience, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and genetic information. So tell us about any accommodations you need. It’s totally confidential and only used to make sure you feel fully supported at every step. DEPT® participates in E-Verify, meaning your Form I-9 information will be sent to the federal government to confirm you are authorized to work in the U.S. We are a B Corp-certified company passionate about purpose-driven work. Our hope is that you can feel good about the contributions DEPT® is making to the world and we always have an open door for your ideas in making the world a better place. DEPT® is a pioneering technology and marketing services company that creates integrated end-to-end digital experiences for brands such as Google, KFC, Philips, Audi, Twitch, Patagonia, eBay and more. Its team of 2,500+ digital specialists across 30+ locations on 5 continents delivers pioneering work on a global scale with a boutique culture. Learn more about DEPT® DIVERSITY, EQUITY, & INCLUSION At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine. We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us. Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here . Show more Show less

As a Solution Architect, it’s your job to ascertain that envisaged solutions become reality. Taking this client-facing role, you are equally comfortable in deep-dive technical workshops and in board-level sales presentations. Having earned your stripes in designing web-based architectures, you have no problem finding the scope in large-scale, complex projects. To the development team, you are the vital mainstay during processes of implementation. To customers and partners, you are the expert liaison with a keen feel for their needs. So besides being a great technician, you are also a considerate companion who delivers remarkable results on a continuous basis. What you'll do You will be part of the development team in which you will fulfill a leading role only gained by excellent performance. Talking highly specific technical details as well as discussing general business outcomes, you comfortably translate customer requirements into a distinguished design. You dedicate yourself to security, deployment, performance, caching, sizing, scalability and serviceability. You know our projects are to be delivered according to briefing, time and budget, but you also know our technicians need their space to build the solutions you’ve defined. By creating structure and clear explanations, you provide guidance and oversight to your team. Also part of the job is creating technical architecture documentation; working with the QA lead to define the test strategy; leading DevOps to define and implement CI/CD pipelines; ensuring that implementations meet non-functional requirements, and you will be traveling a significant amount of the time, spending time on-site during the inception phase and when providing training and workshops. Who you are You have professionally worked with Enterprise Integration Patterns and Frameworks; When we ask you about architectural frameworks, you easily dig up your knowledge and best practices; You have experience with Spring, Maven and Jenkins; You have a demonstrable understanding of Service Oriented Architectures (SOA), as well as Micro-Services Architecture; You know JavaScript frameworks, MVC patterns and principles of REST APIs, ideally including RAML and/or OpenAPI, are second nature to you; Your knowledge of the Java platform exceeds our expectations; You have excellent communication and presentation skills in English and French You are self sufficient as a Solutions Architect and able to manage clients/stakeholders; And let’s not forget your broad, operational knowledge of application servers, databases, load balancers and other infrastructure components required to deploy web applications in a highly available and scalable environment You have experience in distributed and remote agile delivery; You enjoy visiting customers onsite and don't shy away to travel frequently; You have excellent oral and written communication skills in French, Arabic and English; You are based in Casablanca Morocco. We will be extra happy if you: You have created solutions for financial services (especially banking); You have experience with Portal/Web Content Management; You are familiar with architectural patterns, such as Microservices, CQRS, event sourcing; You have experience with containers technology, container orchestration: Kubernetes You have professionally used Integration Platforms, API Gateway, etc. Show more Show less

Cyberint , a market leader in External Risk Management, helping organizations to accelerate the detection, response and remediation of their external threats, was recently acquired by Check Point and is looking for a MSSP Channel Account Manager to cover the Americasand bolster our Customer Success team. This position will report directly to the MSSP CAM team leader. The MSSP CAM will play a pivotal role in the global MSSP expansion strategy, positioning us as the premier cyber intelligence provider globally and the leader in providing MSSP the ability to offer their end customers External Cyber Risk Reduction. If you're driven by the challenge of enhancing the team and our cybersecurity solutions and fostering client relationships, we invite you to apply now! Check Point Software Technologies has been honored by Time Magazine as one of the World’s Best Companies for 2024. We've also earned a spot on the Forbes list of the World’s Best Places to Work for five consecutive years (2020-2024) and recognized as one of the World’s Top Female-Friendly Companies. If you're passionate about making the world a safer place and want to be part of an award-winning company culture, we invite you to join us. Advantage - Proven expertise in external cyber risk, intelligence, and WEBINT domains, as well as collaboration with attack teams (e.g., penetration testers and red teamers) Proficiency in English (Speaking, Reading, Writing) is essential Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a relevant discipline Bi-lingual w/Spanish is required Must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship from an employer now or in the future. job_title: Ingénieur Concepteur Développeur Fullstack .NET / (Angular ou React)
job_summary: Fondé en 1990, SQLI est un groupe européen de services digitaux présent dans 12 pays et implanté depuis déjà 20 ans au Maroc sur Rabat, Oujda et Casablanca. Ses équipes créatives et techniques s'engagent à offrir aux clients, consommateurs ou usagers, des expériences inédites et engageantes en s'appuyant sur le meilleur des technologies et méthodologies ainsi que sur leurs compétences et convictions. En 2022, le groupe SQLI a réalisé un chiffre d’affaires de 246 M€. SQLI est un groupe à taille humaine qui a à cœur l’épanouissement de ses collaborateurs. Son réseau d’agences locales en France et à l’étranger, permet aux collaborateurs de travailler au sein d’équipes dont la taille est propice à la prise d’initiative, l’épanouissement individuel, l’apprentissage, la montée en compétences et offre des opportunités d’évolutions rapides et de parcours de carrière personnalisés. SQLI Maroc compte désormais plus de 700 collaborateurs passionnés du digital. Site web : www.sqli.com Description du poste En tant que Développeur Fullstack .NET vos responsabilités seront de : Développer et maintenir des applications web à l'aide de .NET Participer à la conception et à la mise en œuvre de solutions logicielles de haute qualité Collaboration avec les équipes de développement pour identifier et résoudre les problèmes techniques Élaborer des tests unitaires et de validation pour garantir la qualité du code Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre les besoins des utilisateurs finaux Maintenir la conformité avec les normes et les bonnes pratiques de développement Documenter les processus de développement et les solutions logicielles Qualifications Vous disposez au minimum de 3 années en développement web avec .NET et (Angular ou React) Expérience avec les technologies de base de données relationnelles (SQL) Connaissance des principes de conception et de la programmation orientée objet Connaissance des concepts de sécurité des applications web Expérience en développement d'applications distribuées et en travail en équipe Forte capacité de communication et de collaboration avec les équipes métiers et de développement Désir constant d'apprendre et d'améliorer les compétences professionnelles Une bonne maîtrise du français et de l'anglais. Informations supplémentaires Environnement technique : Microsoft .NET core, SQL Server, C#, Entity Framework Développement Web Back : ASP.NET Core, Web API Développement Web Front : Angular, React, HTML/CSS, PrimeNG Visual Studio, DevOps, GIT, Docker Méthodologie Agile Scrum. Description Bring your IT career and talents to CDW, where you can have a greater impact, be inspired by our mission and excited about your career and future. A Fortune 200 leader, we’re the driven professionals and technology experts companies turn to most to solve their IT challenges. About CDW CDW is a leading multi-brand provider of information technology solutions to business, government, education and healthcare customers around the Globe. A Fortune 500 company and member of the S&P 500 Index, CDW was founded in 1984 and employs over 15,000 coworkers, with headquarters across the United States, United Kingdom and Canada. CDW prides itself on “making amazing happen”. Our relationships are fueled by our deep expertise and are grounded in the CDW Way. Our empowering leadership makes things happen and inspires their teams to do the same. From the teammates beside us to the leaders who guide us, we move forward together. Job Summary Senior corporate ethics and compliance professional with responsibility for providing a broad range of expertise and practical, business-minded advice and support to the Ethics & Compliance programme internationally. This position will monitor external developments and best practice methodologies and remain current on proposed and enacted legislation and regulations affecting ethics and compliance programmes for public companies, providing guidance on CDW’s international compliance and ethics strategy. Reports to the Global Director, Ethics & Compliance based in the U.S. Market competitive compensation. Key responsibilities Lead collaboration with local and global cross-functional teams to manage, maintain and enhance the regulatory and risk framework for the UK and International entities, including controls, policies and procedures and assessment and monitoring of the same. Assist in developing a scalable framework for compliance arrangements relying on smart, consistent, streamlined, technology-supported processes and tools including guidance, templates, checklists, training and controls embedded in IT, ERP and cloud platforms to maximize efficiency and quality of experience for CDW and its customers. Support corporate/internal audits and closure of any corrective actions. Track changes in regulations and laws and analyse their impact on CDW’s products, technologies, and supply chain. Collaborate with the global Ethics and Compliance team and other risk and assurance functions to develop, provide guidance on and support for the development and execution of global strategic goals and initiatives. Build, cultivate and drive a strong culture of high ethical standards of conduct as an organization, including support of ethics and compliance champions across CDW’s international locations. Oversee and manage CDW’s confidential ethics and compliance hotline for UK and international cases, including working with other key internal stakeholders to: manage investigations; identify key trends and outcomes; develop reporting for CDW’s Audit Committee; and raise awareness for reporting with international entities/locations Build effective relationships with international business leaders to become their go-to, trusted advisor, providing practical guidance on diverse regulatory and compliance matters within function. Work with Legal, Risk, Ethics & Compliance team, other departments and external advisors in order to complete projects in an efficient manner. Advise upon supplier onboarding, due diligence and ongoing compliance and review to support CDW business activities and relationships. Qualifications, Skills & Experience Experience managing risk, ethics and compliance matters for a global, public company, with particular experience within EMEA and APAC Experience with acquisitions, divestitures and similar transactions, including integration of ethics and compliance into M&A diligence and post-close integration activities. High degree of technology literacy and familiarity with technology-based compliance systems in particular. Experience building, motivating and managing high performance teams. Willingness to travel as required (less than 10%). Essential Attributes Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Experience in a senior compliance role, with a demonstrable ability to develop, support, and continuously improve a risk-based global ethics and compliance function. Proven success in partnering with and effectively counseling internal stakeholders on a wide array of ethics and compliance-related issues, such as anti-corruption, international trade, anti-trust, internal investigations and issues impacting public sector sales. Ability to work autonomously, issue-spot and provide incisive, practical and business-focused advice and counsel. Creativity and resourcefulness. Strong problem-solving skills with a pragmatic orientation. Ability to balance strategic and tactical issues. Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to facilitiate workshops and training and to clearly and concisely articulate complex concepts and to interact with stakeholders of all levels, including senior management. Proven awareness of risk management and control methodologies and approaches e.g. COSO Framework. Excellent analytical skills and the ability to seek out and understand granular levels of detail, ambiguity and complexity and to present and promote practical solutions. Service-oriented attitude, high standards of ethics and professional integrity, passionate commitment, intellectual curiosity, growth mindset. Exceptional organizational and project management skills and the ability to work under pressure, prioritize, and manage workloads to meet deadlines in a challenging and fast-paced environment. Team player who welcomes responsibility and engagement. Eagerness to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and other coworkers to maintain an awareness of developments within the wider business and support opportunities for standardisation across geographies where applicable. Ability to influence and engage with senior stakeholders and drive actions to completion. Adaptable to changing needs, priorities and deadlines. More about CDW and your career with us: At CDW, you’ll work with people who inspire you. People with positive, success-driven attitudes whom you will learn and forge strong relationships with. Bring your best true self — and your best ideas — to CDW. Because diverse perspectives bring forth better problem solving — and better solutions for our customers in a rapidly evolving technology landscape. CDW is an equal opportunity employer committed to maintaining a policy of non-discrimination towards all coworkers and applicants for employment in all aspects of employment. CDW does not discriminate against any applicant because of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion/belief, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other basis that is prohibited by local employment law, including those protected by the UK Equality Act 2010. We encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply and join us in our mission of cultivating a culture of belonging, diversity and inclusion for better collaboration, innovation, and business results. Together, we strive to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong and is empowered to bring their full energy, capabilities and authenticity for coworker and business benefits. Will you be a part of it? What we offer: Life Assurance Competitive Contributory Pension Private Medical Insurance Enhanced Maternity Pay 25 days holiday + bank holidays Option to buy additional holiday Dental Insurance Season Ticket Loan + additional perks Who we are: CDW is a leading technology solutions provider to business, government, education and healthcare organizations across the globe. Our fingerprints can be found on technology in workplaces of more than 250,000 companies; from fresh-faced start-ups to international conglomerates. With the breadth of products and services we offer, there is no request too big or too small. What you can expect from us: Culture, coworkers, careers. CDW is not only the People Who Get IT but the People who get People. Our relationships are fueled by our deep expertise and grounded in the CDW Way. Our empowering leadership makes things happen and inspires their teams to do the same. From the teammates beside us to the leaders who guide us, we move forward together. At CDW, you’ll work with people who inspire you. People with positive, success-driven attitudes who you will learn from and forge strong relationships with. Bring your best true self—and your best ideas—to CDW. Because diverse perspectives bring forth better problem solving—and better solutions for our customers on a rapidly evolving technology landscape. Show more Show less

Bedroc is hiring a variety of Engineers on team, some of the team will focus in do the day to day networking operations and some engineers who will focus of orohect related items such as integration if acquired facilities. Day to day will look like: Work in a mission-critical role as a Network Engineer in the Network Services team responsible for day-to-day technical and service oversight as of the enterprise Network. Provide technical leadership across the network environment specifically across operational activities, major incidents, and problem management, but also across review and advisory activities for implementation projects. Be closely involved in tooling and projects to automate network workflows. Evangelize best NetDev engineering practices and processes as code, fostering automation, version control, and consistency within and across teams. Work with the architecture, engineering, capabilities owners/managers, vendor management and service providers’ teams to onboard new products and represent operations as required to ensure acceptance into service is successfully delivered. Manage operational related internal client communication and escalations as needed and proactively drive incident resolutions. Work closely with IT leadership to make a real impact in terms of production stability, continuous service improvement and best practice sharing across the environment. Document processes, best practices, and architectural decisions. Enhance security and ensure compliance by identifying vulnerabilities, enforcing security policies, and automating remediation tasks. On-Call Support: Provide expert troubleshooting and support as part of an on-call rotation to swiftly address and resolve network outages and disruptions. Technology Overview: Route Switch, Palo Alto Firewall, Cisco, Data Center Must have technical and soft skills: Network professional with 8 years experience Networking certification or equivalent level of experience working in a 3rd line infrastructure role along with exceptional analytical, conceptual, problem-solving, and problem management abilities. Demonstrable track record of support and troubleshooting of core network enterprise infrastructure and devices around Cisco, and Palo Alto technologies as well as experience in working with wide area networks. In depth understanding and strong troubleshooting skills across all key technologies in Enterprise Data Center and Client LAN Networks (e.g., ACI, VRF, HSRP, VPC, LACP, QoS, Multicast, EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, TCP/IP & UDP, SNMP, FTP, TFTP, SSH, IPSec. VLAN, VXLAN, VPN, EVPN). In depth understanding and strong troubleshooting skills across WAN technologies (e.g. SDWAN, MPLS) and Firewalls will be advantageous (e.g. Palo Alto, Fortinet, Sonicwall, Cisco ASA), as well as various wireless technologies – Extreme, Meraki, Aruba and various load balancers F5, Citrix, AWS/Azure, etc Show more Show less

Senior Full Stack Engineer CSC Generation Enterprise (CSC) is an AI-enabled multi-brand platform that acquires and transforms retailers into profitable, digital-first, consumer-centric businesses. CSC's retail platform is purpose built around its core M&A strategy and drives alpha by encoding revenue growth, unit margin management, and other expert-level retail practices into automation and AI. CSC owns and operates more than 10 retail, eCommerce, and wholesale brands, including Sur La Table, Backcountry, and One Kings Lane. As a Senior Backend/Full Stack Engineer (Python) , you will work on a team to build best-in-class microservices, business-facing user dashboards, and customer-facing experiences. This is 80% Backend/ Python and 20% fronted/React JS role. Our senior full-stack engineers own the technical facets of our various services within our application cloud. We are building a constellation of API-and-SDK first, composable services, working to make our systems programmable and discoverable for other teams within the business. You should love quality abstractions, good systems design, and patterns as much as we do. This role is challenging – above and beyond the day-to-day responsibilities, you’ll have a big role within a fast-paced team. This position will report into the Director of Supply Chain Management , Product and Engineering What you get to do every day: Work with product teams to architect and implement a service in our retail cloud Design and implement microservices in Python to be deployed in AWS as ECS Design and implement in TypeScript / JavaScript, React, NodeJS Building quality, functional code that you and your team can be proud of Publish APIs, SDKs, and CLIs for your systems that other developers can use Write responsive and functional components in React for the front-end Learn and keep up with current best practices for elegant code and projects What you bring to the role: Can work on both frontend and backend components of an application (if you're stronger on the frontend or backend, we'd still like to hear from you) Can be the technical owner of an internally facing consumer microservice product Has around 5+ years of experience, in areas of our tech stack: Python, TypeScript, JavaScript, Node, React, AWS (ie: Lambda, CloudFront, CodePipeline, this one is trainable) Strong sense of ownership for the entire software lifecycle, not only to the next handoff Believe in finding the best solution, not just one that works What’s in it for you? Canada Competitive compensation Medical/Dental/Vision benefits through Greenshield- Health Benefits 100% employer paid! job_summary: Workers Compensation Associate Office Location(s) : Los Angeles, San Diego, San Francisco and Orange County Remote Work Flexibility Experience the freedom of working remotely for a portion of your workweek. Our infrastructure enables seamless communication, collaboration, and access to resources from anywhere. About the Company Manning Kass is a national civil litigation defense firm that stands out from the rest—every case and client matters. Established in 1994 with just sixteen attorneys, we have expanded over the past thirty years to more than 160 attorneys across seven offices, including major economic hubs like New York and Los Angeles. About the Role We are seeking a Workers Compensation Associate to join our Team. The position manages a diverse range of cases, including defending employers and insurers against employment related litigation. Associates work closely with lead attorneys daily, engaging in all phases of litigation—from case evaluation and discovery to attending workers’ compensation appeal board hearing. Responsibilities Managing discovery, including propounding and responding to written discovery. Taking and defending depositions, while analyzing, documents and executing litigation strategies on behalf of the client. Proactively manage communications with clients throughout the course of litigation. Insurance claims experience and subrogation is a plus, but not necessary. Professional Development Opportunities We are committed to investing in our team's professional growth. Our distinctive "Manning Kass University" training program offers tailored education and development opportunities to help you thrive as a successful lawyer. Opportunity to mediate, arbitrate, and try cases while learning from the firm’s experienced ABOTA trial attorneys. Requirements Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree is required. Active membership in the California State Bar in good standing. Demonstrated experience in workers compensation defense, preferably within a law firm setting. The ideal candidate should have 1 + years of workers compensation experience. Exceptional communication and advocacy skills, both verbal and written with a capacity to be a proactive team player. Company Offers Salary starting at $110,000- $150,000+ bonus. Salary is commensurate with experience. Job Overview: The primary responsibility as a Recruiter is to support the recruitment process within the organization. The role will play a critical role in identifying, attracting, and hiring top talent across various departments and levels. This position demands exceptional communication, networking, and organizational skills, as well as a keen understanding of client’s needs and industry trends. The essential responsibilities of the position are listed below in the following key areas: Collaborate with clients’ hiring managers and executives to develop comprehensive recruitment strategies aligned with the organization's goals and workforce requirements. Utilize various sourcing methods (e.g., job boards, social media, networking, referrals, etc.) to attract qualified candidates. Proactively build and maintain a network of potential candidates through consistent outreach and relationship-building activities. Form strong relationships with past applicants and passive candidates for future opportunities. Review and screen resumes/CVs to identify potential matches for open positions. Conduct thorough remote/in person interviews (behavioral, competency-based, technical, etc.) to assess candidates' suitability for specific roles. Utilize assessment tools and techniques to evaluate candidates' skills, personality traits, and cultural fit. Promote the organization's employer brand through various channels and initiatives to attract top talent. Ensure a positive and engaging candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Manage salary negotiations with selected candidates in collaboration with HR and hiring managers. Maintain accurate and up-to-date recruitment data in the applicant tracking system (ATS). Analyze and report key metrics and provide insights to stakeholders and recruiting team. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and recruitment best practices to enhance the effectiveness of recruitment efforts. Identify new sourcing methods and platforms to attract passive candidates. Provide invaluable support to the recruiting team, offering assistance as deemed necessary. Possess the ability to successfully finalize deals and effectively conduct full cycle recruiting independently. Consistently conduct proactive follow-ups with hiring managers to identify open positions. Actively present and promote top-tier or highly recommended applicants to our clients. Develop new clients and build up strong relationships with clients for job orders through a variety of methods, including networking, cold calling, and leveraging their existing client base. Driven by results, and meet or exceed monthly sales goal expectations. Research accounts and prospects, identify key players and generate interest. Promoting the company's reputation and attractiveness as a good employment opportunity. Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations throughout the hiring process. Perform other duties as assigned by upper management. Experience: 1+ years recruiting, sales, and marketing experience preferred. Hands-on experience in various selection processes, such as phone/video interviews, in-person interviews, reference checks, etc. with a focus on full-cycle recruiting preferred. Demonstrate a strong work ethic and unwavering commitment. Thrives in a fast-paced environment and demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities and manage time effectively. Proficient in utilizing diverse sourcing techniques, recruitment platforms, job boards, and skilled in working with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment software. Demonstrated expertise in conducting comprehensive interviews and assessments. Possesses exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities, both verbal and written. Knowledgeable about employment laws and regulations is plus. Exhibits strong organizational and time management proficiencies. Advanced computer skills, including Microsoft Office (Word / Excel), and google suites. Ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with hiring managers and candidates. Results-oriented mindset with a focus on meeting recruitment goals and deadlines. Bilingual proficiency in English and Japanese is advantageous, although not required. Strong understanding of recruitment processes, techniques, and best practices. Stay updated on current news and economic conditions. We offer competitive compensation packages (There is a commission structure for this position) and opportunities for career growth within our organization. If you are a motivated individual who is passionate about recruiting bilingual talent, we would love to hear from you. Salary: Base salary plus COMMISSION PAY Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position and does not encompass all the responsibilities and duties required. Job Type: Full-time Show more Show less

company_name: Train à grande fréquence - High Frequency Rail
job_summary: Chez VIA TGF, nous réimaginons le service de transport ferroviaire de passagers au nom du gouvernement du Canada ! Notre objectif est de créer un nouveau réseau ferroviaire durable qui circulera plus rapidement, plus souvent et de manière plus fiable entre Toronto et Québec. Nous sommes le plus grand projet d'infrastructure du Canada depuis des générations. Êtes-vous prêt à entreprendre un défi stimulant et percutant? Ne cherchez plus : VIA TGF est à la recherche d'un·e développeur·euse, Base de données. Nous recherchons un·e développeur·euse, Base de données compétent·e et motivé·e ayant une expérience en SQL et en entreposage de données pour soutenir nos systèmes au niveau de l'entreprise. Le rôle Ce rôle requiert la capacité de collaborer avec les utilisateurs et les analystes de l'entreprise, en veillant à ce que nos solutions de données répondent aux besoins de l'organisation tout en conduisant à des résultats significatifs. Les responsabilités Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des pipelines de données robustes en utilisant une architecture en médaillon pour un stockage et une récupération efficace. Étendre les fonctionnalités de SharePoint à l'aide de formulaires, de pièces Web et de technologies d'application. Développer et maintenir des rapports Power BI. S'engager directement avec les clients pour diriger la mise en œuvre de solutions analytiques, en veillant à ce que l'expérience utilisateur soit réussie. Gérer les sources de données structurées, semi-structurées et non structurées. Examiner le code pour s'assurer qu'il répond aux exigences, que les modèles d'exécution sont optimaux et que les normes établies sont respectées. Gérer les technologies O365 (Teams, OneDrive, Power Platform et SharePoint). Les compétences techniques Une solide compréhension des meilleures pratiques en matière d'architecture des données, notamment des techniques de modélisation des données, des principes de conception des entrepôts de données et des lacs de données, et des stratégies d'intégration des données et de gestion du cycle de vie afin de créer des écosystèmes de données robustes et évolutifs. Connaissance et expérience de la mise en œuvre des meilleures pratiques en matière de gouvernance des données, y compris l'élaboration et l'application de politiques, normes et procédures en matière de données afin de garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et la sécurité des données, tout en promouvant une utilisation et une gestion conforme des données. Maîtrise de l'écriture de requêtes et de la programmation SQL, y compris les procédures stockées et la rétro-ingénierie des processus existants. Connaissance approfondie des bases de données ADF, ADLS et Azure Sql. Compréhension de AZURE DEVOPS. Les exigences Diplôme en informatique ou expérience équivalente en analyse des données, ingénierie des données et/ou science des données. Minimum 5 ans d'expérience dans le développement de grands ensembles de données à l'aide de SQL Server. Minimum 5 ans d'expérience avec Power BI. Minimum 5 ans d'expérience pratique dans l'entreposage de données avec Azure, Synapse, Fabric. Certification(s) Cloud. Détenir ou capacité à obtenir une habilitation du gouvernement fédéral canadien au niveau secret. Pourquoi se joindre à VIA TGF ? Des assurances collectives entièrement payées pour vous et votre famille : soins médicaux, dentaires, vie, invalidité, etc. Un régime de retraite et des options d’épargne (REER et CELI) Des avantages sociaux flexibles : accès à des comptes de mieux-être et de santé pour soutenir votre style de vie Des vacances selon votre expérience, disponibles dès l'embauche Un programme de primes incitatives Travailler en mode hybride flexible Un environnement de travail qui encourage l’initiative, l’innovation et les solutions avant-gardistes Une occasion unique de façonner l'avenir du transport au Canada Nous travaillons à créer des équipes fortes et diversifiées Chez VIA TGF, nous croyons à la force des équipes diversifiées. Nous aspirons à offrir un environnement de travail inclusif et équitable où chaque personne peut se développer et s’épanouir. Nous invitons donc toutes les personnes qualifiées, quelques soit leurs identités ou leurs spécificités, à postuler. Vous pouvez en savoir plus sur l'ensemble du projet sur notre site VIA TGF. N’hésitez pas à nous avisez si vous avez besoin d’ajustements durant le processus de recrutement. Nous ferons notre possible pour vous offrir une expérience équitable et agréable, tout en gardant confidentielles les mesures d’ajustement. Notez que nous contacterons uniquement les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue pour une entrevue. Show more Show less

job_title: Debug Engineer | North America | Canada | Europe | Fully Remote
job_summary: What we are looking for: Here at Escape Velocity, we are looking for a Debug Engineer who will be responsible for identifying and resolving technical issues. This role involves performing in-depth analysis and debugging to ensure the product meets high quality/world class standards. The candidate will collaborate with engineering and support teams to enhance system performance and reliability. Requirements What we will do together: Create internal tools that assist in problem solving, improve developer ease to maintain, and identify issues Diagnose and troubleshoot Perform in-depth debugging and analysis of system failures Collaborate with engineering and support teams to resolve technical problems Develop, modify, and debug gameplay software in script and C/C++ Assist in the development and implementation of system improvement strategies Conduct root cause analysis and provide recommendations for corrective actions Utilize diagnostic tools and techniques to identify issues in a timely manner What you will bring: An appetite to cover a wide spectrum of game systems and become a core knowledgebase to support the development team. Ability to decipher 3D math, concepts and apply it to primitive rendering concepts for visualizations Proven experience in debugging and troubleshooting software systems Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication and collaboration abilities Familiarity with diagnostic tools and methodologies Experience with Unreal Engine Benefits Interested... a bit about Escape Velocity: Escape Velocity is a team of passionate, talented developers working at a studio that offers excellent benefits and what we believe is a fantastic project. But that doesn't make us unique. What does make us special? We value the time, energy, and talent of our players and our colleagues. We want every hour spent developing and playing our games to be an incredibly rewarding and worthwhile use of your time. To that end, we are fully remote and support team members nearly anywhere in the world. We prioritize honesty, even when that means sharing bad news. We strive to give everyone autonomy so they can determine how best to work and play, and we care more about what you bring to the game and studio than how many hours you're clocking. We believe in constant improvement across all areas - from the game itself to our production design - and are constantly re-evaluating how we spend our time to ensure that we're not wasting yours and we're all always working on the most important things. Finally (and perhaps most importantly) we're dedicated to building a culture of play, which not only makes us better game makers, but also strengthens the bonds between us all. How to apply: Click apply and complete an application along with a Resume / CV. If we would like to move forward with your application, a member of the Recruiting Team will reach out to you and guide you through our process. Escape Velocity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Applications will be considered regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, race, or any other protected category. Show more Show less

Title: Information Technology Intern Reports to: Supervisor, Information Technology Job Type: Co-op / Internship Location: Inverness, Nova Scotia, B0E 1N0 About Cabot Cape Breton Located on over a mile of sandy beach along the coast of Cape Breton, Nova Scotia—and nestled between the Atlantic Ocean and the picturesque town of Inverness. Cabot Cape Breton features 46 holes of exhilarating golf and one of the best resort experiences in Canada. With two acclaimed World Top 100 courses, a 10-hole short course, 72 rooms of award-winning accommodation at Cabot Links Lodge, 19 upscale Golf Villas, 30 luxury homes, and exquisite dining in three on-site restaurants, Cabot Cape Breton is intended to excite and inspire at every turn. We are seeking out purpose driven and passionate people who embrace Cabot’s values. Our #cabotcrew brings their unique spirit and individual character and shows up with all their heart to create a warm welcome to a magical place where remarkable memories are made. If you join our team, you will live our values: Confidence, Authenticity, Humility, Warmth Position Overview As an IT Intern at Cabot Cape Breton, you will have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience in the dynamic field of information technology while contributing to the success of our world-class golf and hospitality resort. You will work closely with our IT team to troubleshoot various hardware and software systems as needed, assist in network maintenance, oversee IT asset management, and participate in the implementation of IT projects. This role offers a unique learning environment where you will have the chance to collaborate with professionals in the industry, expand your technical skills, and make a meaningful impact on the technology infrastructure that underpins our luxury resort operations. If you're eager to kickstart your IT career, this internship is an excellent opportunity to do so at Cabot Cape Breton. You Will Thrive In This Role If You Enjoy Technology: Have a genuine interest and passion for technology, including hardware, software, and various IT systems and tools. Problem-Solving: Enjoy the process of identifying and resolving technical issues, troubleshooting problems, and finding innovative solutions. Learning: Embrace continuous learning and skill development as the IT field evolves rapidly. Be eager to stay updated on the latest technologies and trends. Team Collaboration: Thrive in a collaborative environment, working closely with IT professionals and other team members to support the organization's technology needs. Attention to Detail: Possess an eye for detail and precision, as IT tasks often require meticulous analysis and accuracy to ensure systems run smoothly and securely. Preferred Qualifications And Skills Currently enrolled in a relevant college or university program. Proficiency in English, both written and spoken. A strong foundation in computer hardware, software, and operating systems Proficiency in at least one programming language, such as Python, Java, C++, or JavaScript Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to troubleshoot technical issues Familiarity with providing technical support, including software installation, hardware, troubleshooting, and user assistance Understanding of basic networking concepts, including IP addressing, subnetting, and network protocols Basic Knowledge of Cybersecurity principles and best practices Willingness and ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing IT environments Requirements Of The Role You Should Be Aware Of Based on the nature of our business and the service we provide to our guests, to work with us, you must consent to a criminal background check as a condition of employment and an additional criminal background check every two years. As a seasonal resort business, you can anticipate a schedule that will involve day, evening, night, and weekend work. Occasionally lifting and carrying objects up to 50 lbs in weight Our Benefits Access to learning & training opportunities to build your career. $ 10 green fees Free Lunch on Workdays Complimentary Family Golf Round Friends and Family Rates for Golf and Lodging Discounts in our Retail Shops & Restaurants Access to our Employee Assistance Program Subsidized Team Housing, based on availability. Healthcare benefits for permanent and returning seasonal team members. Cabot Cape Breton promotes diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity employment and is committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis covered under applicable law. We recognize the importance of a 50+ workforce and value all candidates solely based on their proficiency, qualifications and contributions. If you need accommodation to participate in our selection process, please contact us. Got questions? Reach out to us at careers@cabotcapebreton.com . To submit your application, visit cabotcapebreton.com/careers. We genuinely appreciate every application we receive, and while we value each candidate, we will only be able to contact those selected for an interview. Thank you for considering a career with us! Are you an experienced software engineer looking to contribute your coding expertise to train cutting-edge AI models? Join us to shape the future of AI while working on flexible, remote projects. This freelance opportunity offers flexible hours and remote work, allowing you to contribute on your own schedule.
