At Ascent CFO Solution s, we are a leading Fractional CFO services firm dedicated to providing strategic financial leadership and insights to startups and SMEs. Our mission is to empower businesses to achieve financial clarity and sustainable growth. As we continue to expand our services and client base, we're looking for leading Chief Financial Officers (CFOs) tojoin our dynamic team of fractional financial professionals. In this role, you will serve as a trusted advisor to our diverse portfolio of clients. Your work will be meaningful and exciting, supporting businesses that are going through transformation, growth, process improvement, fundraising, preparing for an exit, and/or looking to acquire other companies. Job Description: This is a hands-on role for a stellar CFO that is entrepreneurial and enjoys working with companies in diverse industries. You will be the primary contact with your clients ensuring the highest level of client satisfaction with responsibility for timelines, accuracy, and completeness of deliverables. On some client engagements you will be leading a team of Accounting staff, and on others you may be providing only strategic advisory services. Our clients include cutting-edge startups, scale-ups, and private companies, in addition to VC- and PE-backed companies across a wide range of industries (Technology, SaaS, Professional Services, Construction, Manufacturing, eCommerce, Healthcare, CPG, FinTech, Real Estate, and more). Can you picture yourself as a member of our team? Primary Responsibilities for this role: Work directly with CEOs and executive teams to develop and execute finance strategy Provide strategic business advice to clients Prepare and maintain financial models, rolling forecasts and cash-flow forecasts Manage the budgetary process and analyze budget vs. actual variances Assist clients in fundraising and/or M&A activity Managing Ascent CFO and/or client resources to oversee/complete the month-end close and reporting packages Onboard clients which may include an assessment phase Establish and implement appropriate accounting processes and internal controls Identify and track key trends and metrics Develop and maintain executive dashboards and KPI monitoring and reporting Coordinate and manage the annual audit and tax return process Financial reporting to key Board of Directors members and shareholders The Ideal Candidate has the following experience: 15+ years of experience in accounting and finance roles, previous experience in full time CFO positions Bachelor's Degree required, CPA license or MBA strongly preferred Experience as a strategic leader, most comfortable being the “right hand” to the CEO Considerable experience with building financial forecast and cash flow models Significant experience raising capital in the venture capital space Passion for energetic leadership in the finance and accounting organization Comfortable with being “hands-on” in accounting and ERP systems including QBOnline, NetSuite, Intacct, and other accounting packages Highly proficient in MS Excel, Google sheets is a plus Compensation: $115-130/hour based on experience Location: Boulder/Denver based preferred, Remote role with some in-person meetings/events Why Our Employees Choose Ascent CFO Solutions: Set your own schedule, choose the number of hours you want to work, generally between 15 and 35 hours/week, and work remotely (with in-person opportunities) Engage with a wide range of business matters across a variety of industries Connect with highly talented Ascent team members (CFOs, VPs Finance, Controllers, Accounting Managers, and Senior Accountants) who are ready and willing to collaborate and support you on projects Benefit from our strong 12+ year reputation in delivering custom engagements with a high level of accuracy, responsiveness, and expertise Work directly with smart entrepreneurs and business leaders who view you as a trusted partner in their companies Benefits include: Employee health, dental and vision insurance 401K match Quarterly stipend towards educational or professional development Technology stipend Paid sick and holiday time Bonus/commission eligibility Promotion and mentoring opportunities Ascent CFO Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. With recent advancements in Generative AI, it is now possible to deliver delightful customer experiences at a fraction of today's cost. Team: Maven has assembled a world-class team from Google, Meta, Amazon, and Stripe, and is supported by executives & Advisors from OpenAI, Google, HubSpot, and Stripe. As a Customer Experience Manager, you will play a pivotal role in enabling Maven customers to reimagine their customer experience, driving efficiency, reducing costs, and enhancing customer satisfaction. Join us on the forefront of innovation and help shape the future of customer success in the AI industry. Strong technical acumen with a deep understanding of generative AI products and capabilities Ability to utilize project management skills, create customer implementation plans including timelines, milestones, checkpoints, and resource management. Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, to effectively educate and guide customers Proven ability to provide hands-on technical services and support to large and complex accounts Familiarity with AI concepts and a keen interest in solving challenging problems in the customer support landscape Adept at building and maintaining strong customer relationships with senior executives Operations-savvy mindset, contributing to the refinement of technical processes Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams to enhance product offerings Proven track record in driving customer success and satisfaction Familiarity with tools and technologies relevant to generative AI Benefits What We Offer: High Impact in cutting-edge field: Be at the vanguard of AI innovation Compensation Package: Competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and meaningful equity stakes Inclusive Culture: A diverse and welcoming work environment where everyone's voice is heard What unites us is our Values and the passion we share to live by them: Do right for our customers We are data-driven Be entrepreneurial Strive to be better, together MavenAGI is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and is committed to fostering an environment where everyone feels included. job_summary: Position: Senior Backup Solutions Architect Location: Downey CA Interview Mode: Video Duration: 12+ months Skills Preferred Proficient with Commvault and Commvaut Cloud Saas Solution, AWS, Microsoft Azure, GCP, and documenting technical information. Ability to communicate with business teams, customers, and technical teams such as network, security, and external vendors. Strong technical skills in architecting infrastructure environments using Commvault Cloud SaaS solution. Work Experience Preferred Strong experience in deploying, supporting, and maintaining data protection in a Hybrid cloud. 6+ years of hands-on experience managing data backup and recovery for diverse on-premises workloads, including VMware, AIX, HP-UX, NAS, Windows, and Linux environments. 6+ years of experience with native backup setups for cloud service providers such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, and GCP. 6+ years of experience in configuring, maintaining, and troubleshooting Commvault SaaS for protecting Microsoft Office 365, Teams, SharePoint, Azure VMs, Blob Storage, AWS EC2, EFS, S3, and GCP VMs. 6+ years of hands-on experience in configuring and managing high-speed backups and restores using IntelliSnap, handling database backups (Oracle, MS-SQL, DB2, PostgreSQL), and managing immutable storage buckets (GCP, AWS, Azure) with WORM configurations in Commvault. 6+ years of experience in Commvault Hyperscale appliances, VTL, tape libraries, and Auto Recovery solutions for VMware and public cloud integrations. 6+ years of experience in troubleshooting Commvault components, configuring firewalls for DMZ/cloud clients, and executing system upgrades and migrations (e.g., Data Dobi, Continuous Data Replication). 5+ years of hands-on experience in Storage with NetApp Cluster Administration, including SVM, volume, and LUN configuration, SMB/NFS file shares, SnapMirror replication, snapshots, encryption, deduplication, and quota management. 5+ years of experience managing Pure FlashArray for volume and object storage configuration, replication, and quota management is critical. 5+ years of experience setting up monitoring and alerting systems like NetApp Active IQ and Pure1 dashboards for performance tracking and virtual infrastructure mapping. Education/Training Preferred A bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or equivalent education can be substituted for experience on a year-to-year basis. • Commvault Certifications: Commvault Certified Professional Administrator • NetApp Certifications: NetApp Certified Data Administrator (NCDA), NetApp Certified Implementation Engineer (NCIE) • Pure Storage Certifications: Pure Storage FlashArray Administrator • Dell EMC Certifications: Dell EMC Isilon Certified Specialist Additional Information Must be local to Los Angeles / willing to drive to an alternate site when required. Onsite is at Downey, California, 90242. Show more Show less

Job Description: We are seeking an experienced Solution Architect to design and architect the infrastructure, workflows, and integration strategies for a robust platform. The role involves creating a scalable, modular, and future-ready architecture that integrates multi-tenant ERP, CRM, and customer portals while ensuring seamless connectivity between internal systems and external APIs. The Solution Architect will be responsible for defining a middleware integration layer, establishing a centralized data management and analytics framework, and implementing a security architecture that ensures data integrity, access control, and compliance. The design must prioritize scalability, modularity, and cloud-based deployments, supporting the phased implementation roadmap and long-term strategic goals. The platform will build along with existing tools like Salesforce CRM , while replacing legacy systems with modern ERP and analytics solutions to optimize cost efficiency, operational performance, and seamless integration. Key Responsibilities: Infrastructure and Workflow Design: Design workflows and architecture for multi-tenant ERP, CRM, and customer portal integrations. Ensure alignment with cloud-based deployment strategies for cost efficiency and scalability. Middleware Integration: Architect a middleware integration layer to connect internal systems (ERP, CRM, and data warehouse) with external systems (e.g., banking APIs). Enable efficient, real-time data flow and ensure integration readiness for future systems. Data Management and Analytics Framework: Establish a centralized framework for data governance, real-time analytics, and compliance reporting. Design systems to support scalable data storage, processing, and reporting. Security Architecture: Define a comprehensive security framework to protect data integrity, ensure access control, and comply with regulatory standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA). Incorporate security best practices for cloud and multi-tenant environments. Future-Readiness and Scalability: Design modular architectures that can accommodate phased enhancements and evolving technology landscapes. Align the architecture with organizational goals and strategic roadmaps. Collaboration and Documentation: Work with technical leads, business stakeholders, and external vendors to translate business requirements into technical designs. Prepare detailed documentation to support future implementation and operationalization phases. Required Skillset: Technical Skills: Strong expertise in cloud architecture (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud). Proficiency in integrating multi-tenant ERP, CRM , and customer portal systems. Experience in designing and implementing middleware integration platforms (e.g., MuleSoft, Dell Boomi, Apache Camel). Knowledge of centralized data management and analytics frameworks , including real-time reporting solutions. Advanced understanding of security frameworks , encryption, identity and access management, and compliance standards. Experience in Salesforce CRM , Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP solutions, and migration from legacy systems. Experience in designing scalable and modular architectures to support phased implementations. Show more Show less

Overview Alera Group is hiring a Benefit Technology Analyst to join our team! This is a remote opportunity. Alera Group was founded in 2017 and has grown to become the 15th largest broker of US business. We are passionate about our clients’ success in the areas of Employee Benefits, Property and Casualty Insurance, Retirement Plan Services, and Wealth Services. With a network of offices nationwide, our commitment to collaboration allows us to offer national resources combined with local service. This position requires a deadline-driven professional with strong communication skills, computer savvy, and experience in HRIS technology, such as Employee Navigator and Ease. Benefits administration and/or experience with a benefits brokerage firm preferred. This position must be self-disciplined enough to work without direct supervision, detail-oriented, great with time management, able to handle a fast-paced work environment, and enjoy working as a member of a team. Comfortable with face-to-face meetings, presentations, and demos to clients. Responsibilities Essential Job Functions - Position manages the day-to-day tasks required for building, launching, administering, and maintaining a client Benefits Administration technology platform, such as Employee Navigator and Ease. Specific Duties & Responsibilities - Project management of all new benefit platform implementations & renewals Promote good Client/Broker Relationship throughout implementations by setting clear expectations, communicating regularly, etc. Manage all implementation documents including timeline Ensure all plans are built correctly, including executing testing and quality control procedures. Submit all file requests and manage follow-up with files submitted to vendor to build Demonstrate system/platform for prospects and clients Collect all necessary new implementation documentation and file documentation Communicate all file costs and any extra costs involved that were not previously communicated clearly and in a timely manner Enter data into computer systems, generate reports, archive electronic information appropriately, and other similar activities Oversee the work of other implementation coordinators assigned to the implementation Attend all administrative trainings for staff and external stakeholders as needed Attend and facilitate all implementation and/or renewal calls Attend all team calls and meetings Contribute to strategic processes and procedures of the team Manage all issues quickly and professionally Report all escalated issues to Team Lead and the Director of Benefit Support Services Manage handoff process from implementation/renewal to ongoing service teams Accountable for successful implementations & renewals Complete job-related training courses/seminars as needed Provide reporting updates to internal teams or management Other duties as assigned Qualifications Prior experience with HRIS/ben admin software. Employee Navigator required. Ease preferred High School diploma or GED, with a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant topic preferred Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in HR, IT, benefits, or other applicable area Superior written and verbal communication skills coupled with great interpersonal and EQ skills Organized, creative, responsive problem-solver who thinks through all the possible outcomes before moving forward Solid knowledge of and experience with employee benefits and administration of Group benefit plans highly preferred Demonstrated success providing excellent customer service coupled with extreme attention to details and strong math skills Successfully prioritizes multiple projects simultaneously to meet tight deadlines Works well independently with minimal direction and also collaborates well on teams Superior computer savvy and good facility with MS Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Benefits This job is fully remote. Alera Group offers comprehensive benefits to our colleagues, including medical, dental, life and disability insurance, 401k, generous paid time off and much more. Salary range is $55K to 75K per year. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other protected class. CULTIVATE A BETTER WORLD Food served fast does not have to be a typical fast-food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We are changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you will join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone. THE OPPORTUNITY The Lead Analyst, People Data provides critical support to the business around issues of organizational health and is responsible creative storytelling to help influence People-related business decisions. As a Lead Analyst you'll be a strategic and critical thinker, detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, a creative storyteller who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. This role involves interpreting and overseeing large amounts of People data and collaborating with functional leaders at all levels of the organization. Your position will work with several systems, dashboards and reports to provide thorough data analytics and drive crucial decision-making. The suitable candidate will have experience within the human resources field, data analytics and ideally technology implementation/design. Additionally, you must be able to design engaging presentations that communicate complex ideas in an easy to understand manner. WHAT YOU’LL DO In addition to following Chipotle’s policies and procedures, principal accountabilities include, but are not limited to: Apply your expertise in data & quantitative analysis to see beyond the numbers and translate complex business issues into actionable insights. Partner with stakeholders to identify business problems and translate them into functional requirements. Grow strong relationships within your assigned HR and cross-functional stakeholder groups, develop a deep understanding of their current business challenges, and proactively seek out ways to add value through data analysis. Drive adoption and usage of current and future People Analytics solutions. Inform requirements for analytics solutions roadmap and future enhancements based on your ongoing stakeholder feedback. Oversee and interpret People data, metrics, and statistics from multiple sources, and apply this data to make recommendations related to our HR functions, including recruitment, restaurant field operations, total rewards, and compliance. Strategically think about People data and how we might improve/iterate existing systems and tools. Provide strategic and technical leadership for analytics projects and support work. Present, explain and discuss results of analyses concisely and effectively to drive fact-based decision making at all levels within the organization. Leverage external benchmarking on key metrics and analytics practices. Function in an independent manner, displaying critical thinking to meet deadlines and deliverables. Assist the team with ad-hoc projects, analyses and support as needed. WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE To perform this job successfully, you’ll need to be able to perform each essential duty. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Business Administration, or Human Resources preferred. 5-8 years of experience as an HR Analyst or in a similar role. Expertise in implementing/designing HRIS systems like Workday, and analytics tools such as Workday Prism and Power BI. Ability to interpret and simplify complex data into accessible, impactful insights. Skilled in creative storytelling, presenting data through compelling visuals, presentations, and charts. Experience working effectively with cross-functional leaders and managing tight deadlines. Strong ability to manage and deliver short- and long-term projects. Excellent judgment, decision-making, and prioritization skills. Capable of multitasking in a fast-paced work environment. Strong communication skills and professional presence, with the ability to collaborate with executives and business partners at all levels. Ability to travel up to 25% PAY TRANSPARENCY A reasonable estimate of the current base pay range for this position is $111,000.00–$154,500.00. You are also eligible for annual cash bonuses and equity awards based upon performance and other factors. Actual compensation offered may vary depending on skill level, experience, and/or education. Chipotle offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401k, sick leave, vacation time, and much more. Visit https://jobs.chipotle.com/benefits for more details. WHO WE ARE Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle has restaurants in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants in North America and Europe. With employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. For more information or to place an order online, visit WWW.CHIPOTLE.COM Chipotle Mexican Grill is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. As a people-first company rooted in values, our purpose extends beyond serving nutritious food using real ingredients. It means hiring world-class individuals and fostering a culture that champions diversity, ensures equity, and celebrates inclusion. All qualified applicants, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. Please contact ADAaccommodations@chipotle.com if you need an accommodation due to a disability to complete an application, job interview, and/or to otherwise participate in the hiring process. This email does not respond to non-accommodations related requests. Show more Show less

We are seeking a dynamic and strategic leader to join our team as the Director of Human Resources (HR). This individual will be responsible for shaping and executing a forward-thinking HR strategy that aligns with our business goals, with a specific focus on fostering an inclusive, engaging, and high-performing company culture. In addition, the Director of HR will partner closely with leaders across the organization to drive business results and build high-performance teams. This role also includes oversight of the HR Manager, who handles the daily operational aspects of HR functions. Key Responsibilities: Talent Development & Retention: Build a robust talent development program that promotes growth opportunities, leadership development, and skill-building across all levels. Create strategies that attract, retain, and motivate top talent while enhancing succession planning. Talent Acquisition Develop strategies and identify demographic segments to attract and retain talent, building brand awareness and a future candidate pool. Evaluate and elevate the employee value proposition working toward maximizing opportunities for growth and development. Employee Engagement: Design and implement engagement strategies that create a positive employee experience and increase retention. Develop and oversee regular employee engagement surveys and action plans that respond to feedback. Strive to offer an employee experience that is welcoming, inclusive, and collaborative; fueling purpose and belonging. Culture Leadership & Strategy: Steward and foster company culture, ensuring alignment with the company’s purpose, values, and long-term strategic goals. Champion a culture of inclusion, innovation, and collaboration. Organizational Development: Partner with the leadership team to drive organizational design and development efforts that align with the business’s evolving needs. Facilitate change management strategies that promote adaptability, resilience, and agility. Performance Management: Oversee and facilitate the implementation of a performance management system that promotes accountability, recognizes high performance, and provides clear feedback and development paths. Partner and support managers in delivery of feedback. Oversight of HR Operations: Provide guidance, direction, and support to the HR Manager, who is responsible for day-to-day HR operations, including payroll, benefits administration, employee onboarding, and compliance. Ensure operational HR activities are effectively managed and aligned with strategic initiatives. Partnership with Leaders to Drive Results: C ollaborate with senior leaders to align HR strategies with business objectives. Act as a strategic advisor to department heads and leadership teams to ensure that HR initiatives support and drive business outcomes. Focus on building high-performance teams that deliver results, fostering a performance-driven environment. High-Performance Team Building: Develop and implement programs to support team cohesion, leadership effectiveness, and employee performance. Facilitate leadership development initiatives and coaching to ensure managers and leaders are equipped to build and sustain high-performance teams. HR Policies & Compliance: Ensure all HR policies are in line with legal standards and best practices while supporting the organization’s unique culture. Work with the HR Manager to implement procedures that are fair, transparent, and effectively communicated to employees. Employee Relations & Conflict Resolution: Act as a trusted advisor to senior leadership on all HR matters, providing guidance on employee relations issues. Lead conflict resolution efforts, fostering a workplace environment that is open, collaborative, and respectful. Leadership & Coaching: Provide leadership, mentorship, and direction to the HR team, including direct oversight of the HR Manager. Ensure the HR team is equipped to support the business and its people effectively. Serve as a coach and confidant to executives and managers, helping to develop leadership capabilities across the organization. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field; Master’s degree desired. 5+ years of HR experience, with at least 2 years in a manager or higher role Expertise in employee recruitment, engagement, organizational development, and talent management. Strong leadership and team-building skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate across departments. Deep knowledge of HR best practices, compliance regulations, and employment law. Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and conflict resolution skills. Key Competencies: The ability to inspire a positive, high-energy work environment. Strategic thinker with a strong understanding of how to align HR initiatives with business objectives. A deep commitment to steward leadership, forward-thinking and action, and growth and development in service of the workforce and stakeholders. Strong relationship-building skills with a focus on employee experience and well-being. Expertise in developing and supporting high-performance teams that deliver measurable results. Why Join Us? Be part of an innovative, purpose-driven organization that is committed to fostering a vibrant and inclusive culture. Opportunity to shape the future of our workforce and create an impactful employee experience. Collaborate with a forward-thinking leadership team that values HR as a key driver of business success. Show more Show less

job_summary: Company Overview With 80,000 customers across 150 countries, UKG is the largest U.S.-based private software company in the world. And we’re only getting started. Ready to bring your bold ideas and collaborative mindset to an organization that still has so much more to build and achieve? Read on. At UKG, you get more than just a job. You get to work with purpose. Our team of U Krewers are on a mission to inspire every organization to become a great place to work through our award-winning HR technology built for all. Here, we know that you’re more than your work. That’s why our benefits help you thrive personally and professionally, from wellness programs and tuition reimbursement to U Choose — a customizable expense reimbursement program that can be used for more than 200+ needs that best suit you and your family, from student loan repayment, to childcare, to pet insurance. Our inclusive culture, active and engaged employee resource groups, and caring leaders value every voice and support you in doing the best work of your career. If you’re passionate about our purpose — people —then we can’t wait to support whatever gives you purpose. We’re united by purpose, inspired by you. Internship Program Details To be eligible for this program you must be able to work in a hybrid environment and be on site 3 days per week. This is a full-time role Monday through Friday from 9:00am – 5:00pm EST. Must be available May 20th - August 8th. About The Program UKG’s Intern Academy program is dedicated to helping college students jump start their business careers at a top-ranked technology company that cares about its people. Our interns work on enriching projects that have a significant business impact on the future of our company. In addition to your day-to-day work with your team, interns get to experience our award-winning culture through mentorship, learning programs, team-building activities, networking events, and more. We have big ideas — and need big thinkers to help us realize them. About The Software Engineering Track Our program is not your average internship experience - you will be working alongside some of the most talented engineers in the industry doing the same work they do, with daily mentoring and code reviews. Our interns write and test production-level code and are critical in helping our engineering organization achieve their deliverables. Interns are immersed in a technical bootcamp that prepares them for the software development environment. Come make an impact with the best and brightest technologists in the world! Practical, real-world experience that will impact our 70,000+ global customers Daily mentoring from your technical mentor Participation in code reviews in an Agile environment An immersive onboarding bootcamp Participation in social events, community outreach opportunities, professional development seminars, trainings, and more! Paid internship with potential for a full-time offer that comes with top-rated benefits Basic Qualifications Well versed in Java/Python/C#, Object Oriented Programming, Data Structures & Algorithms with overall strong technical knowledge Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline Preferred Qualifications We prioritize rising juniors and seniors for this internship program as we view it as a potential talent pipeline for future full-time roles within our organization A team player mentality with a continuous desire to learn and improve A strong communicator with awesome problem-solving skills Drive to learn and grow Quebec candidates: While French is required for Quebec roles, use of the English language is also required due to the global nature of the business and the need to interact with UKG US headquarters and international sites. Where we’re going UKG is on the cusp of something truly special. Worldwide, we already hold the #1 market share position for workforce management and the #2 position for human capital management. Tens of millions of frontline workers start and end their days with our software, with billions of shifts managed annually through UKG solutions today. Yet it’s our AI-powered product portfolio designed to support customers of all sizes, industries, and geographies that will propel us into an even brighter tomorrow! Ultimate Kronos Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws. Disability Accommodation For individuals with disabilities that need additional assistance at any point in the application and interview process, please email UKGCareers@ukg.com. Avec 80 000 clientes et clients répartis dans 150 pays, UKG est la plus grande entreprise de logiciels privée basée aux États-Unis dans le monde. Et nous ne faisons que commencer. Voulez-vous apporter vos idées audacieuses et votre esprit de collaboration à une organisation qui a encore beaucoup à construire et à réaliser? Lisez la suite. Chez UKG, vous obtenez plus qu’un simple emploi. Le travail se fait dans un but précis. Notre équipe de Krewers est en mission pour inspirer chaque organisation à devenir un excellent lieu de travail avec notre technologie RH primée, conçue pour toutes et tous. Ici, nous savons que vous représentez plus que votre travail. C’est pourquoi nos avantages sociaux vous aident à vous épanouir personnellement et professionnellement, des programmes de bien-être et du remboursement de droits de scolarité à U Choose — un programme de remboursement de dépenses personnalisable qui peut être utilisé pour plus de 200 besoins qui vous conviennent le mieux, à vous et à votre famille, du remboursement de prêt étudiant, à la garde d’enfants, en passant par l’assurance pour animaux de compagnie. Notre culture inclusive, nos groupes de ressources pour les employé(e)s actifs et engagés, et nos dirigeant(e)s bienveillant(e)s valorisent chaque voix et vous soutiennent dans la réalisation du meilleur travail de votre carrière. Si notre raison d’être (les personnes) vous passionne, il nous tarde de soutenir ce qui vous donne un but. Nos objectifs nous unissent, vous êtes notre source d’inspiration. À Propos Du Stage De Développeur Logiciel Notre programme n’est pas un stage ordinaire : vous travaillerez aux côtés d’ingénieurs parmi les plus talentueux de l’industrie et ferez le même travail qu’eux, tout en bénéficiant d’un mentorat au quotidien et de revues de code. Nos stagiaires écrivent et testent du code destiné à la production, et jouent un rôle essentiel en aidant notre équipe d’ingénierie à livrer ses projets. Les stagiaires sont immergés dans un camp d’entraînement technique qui les prépare au monde du développement logiciel. Venez faire bouger les choses aux côtés des technologues les plus talentueux et brillants du monde ! Détails Du Programme De Stage Pour bénéficier de ce programme, vous devez être en mesure de travailler dans un environnement hybride avec trois jours de présence par semaine. Il s’agit d’un poste à temps plein, du lundi au vendredi, de 9 h à 17 h (heure de l’Est). Vous devez être disponible du 20 may au 8 août. À Propos Du Programme Le programme Académie des stagiaires d’UKG a pour but d’aider les étudiants à démarrer leur carrière dans une entreprise technologique de premier plan qui prend soin de ses employés. Nos stagiaires participent à des projets enrichissants qui influencent de manière significative l’avenir de notre entreprise. En plus de travailler quotidiennement au sein d’une équipe, les stagiaires ont l’occasion de découvrir notre culture primée grâce au mentorat, aux programmes d’apprentissage, aux activités de renforcement de l’esprit d’équipe, aux événements de réseautage, etc. Nos idées sont ambitieuses, et il nous faut des penseurs visionnaires pour nous aider à les concrétiser. À propos de la filière de développement logiciel : Notre programme n’est pas un stage ordinaire : vous travaillerez aux côtés d’ingénieurs parmi les plus talentueux de l’industrie et ferez le même travail qu’eux, tout en bénéficiant d’un mentorat au quotidien et de revues de code. Nos stagiaires écrivent et testent du code destiné à la production, et jouent un rôle essentiel en aidant notre équipe d’ingénierie à livrer ses projets. Les stagiaires sont immergés dans un camp d’entraînement technique qui les prépare au monde du développement logiciel. Venez faire bouger les choses aux côtés des technologues les plus talentueux et brillants du monde ! Une expérience pratique et concrète qui fera la différence pour nos plus de 70 000 clients à travers le monde Un encadrement quotidien assuré par votre mentor technique La participation aux revues de code dans un environnement Agile Un camp d’entraînement immersif La participation à des événements sociaux, à des actions de proximité, à des séminaires de développement professionnel, à des formations, etc. Un stage rémunéré pouvant déboucher sur un poste à temps plein assorti d’avantages sociaux compétitifs Qualifications Requises Maîtrise de Java/Python/C#, de la programmation orientée objet, des structures de données et des algorithmes avec de solides connaissances techniques générales Vous poursuivez actuellement des études en informatique ou dans une discipline technique connexe Qualifications Souhaitées Ce programme de stage s’adresse en priorité aux jeunes diplômé(e)s et aux seniors, car nous le considérons comme un canal de talents susceptibles d’occuper des postes à temps plein au sein de notre organisation Esprit d’équipe et désir constant d’acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et de s’améliorer Talent marqué pour la communication et excellentes compétences en résolution de problèmes Volonté d’apprendre et d’évoluer Candidats du Québec: Bien que le français soit exigé pour les postes au Québec, l'utilisation de l'anglais est également requise en raison de la nature mondiale de l'entreprise et de ses affaires, de même que de la nécessité d'interagir avec les employés ou les partenaires du siège américain d'UKG et de ses bureaux internationaux. UKG s’apprête à vivre quelque chose de vraiment spécial. À l’échelle mondiale, nous nous classons déjà au premier rang pour la gestion des ressources humaines et au deuxième rang pour la gestion du capital humain. Des dizaines de millions de personnes travaillant en première ligne commencent et terminent leur journée avec notre logiciel, et des milliards de quarts de travail sont gérés chaque année par le biais des solutions UKG aujourd’hui. Pourtant, c’est notre portefeuille de produits alimentés par l’IA et conçus pour soutenir la clientèle de toutes tailles, de tous secteurs et de toutes zones géographiques qui nous propulsera vers des lendemains encore plus radieux! Employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi Ultimate Kronos Group est fier d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi et s’engage à maintenir un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, au sexe, à l’âge, au handicap, à l’état matrimonial, à la situation familiale, à l’orientation sexuelle, à la grossesse, à l’information génétique, à l’identité de genre, à l’expression de genre, à l’origine nationale, à l’ascendance, au statut de citoyen, au statut d’ancien combattant et à tout autre statut protégé par les lois fédérales, provinciales ou locales contre la discrimination. Accommodement aux handicaps UKG s’engage à fournir un accommodement aux personnes handicapées durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue. Si vous avez besoin d’un accommodement durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue, veuillez communiquer avec nous à UKGCareers@ukg.com . Quebec candidates: While French is required for Quebec roles, use of the English language is also required due to the global nature of the business and the need to interact with UKG US headquarters and international sites. Candidats du Québec: Bien que le français soit exigé pour les postes au Québec, l'utilisation de l'anglais est également requise en raison de la nature mondiale de l'entreprise et de ses affaires, de même que de la nécessité d'interagir avec les employés ou les partenaires du siège américain d'UKG et de ses bureaux internationaux. job_summary: Who we are? At Upstream Works, we are all about making life easier – for our partners, customers, and each other. Together, we build innovative solutions that make an impact – whether it is making agents more productive, improving the customer experience, or helping our team be the best version of themselves. Across the organization is an unwavering commitment to learning, career development, and personal growth. Our teams collaborate and motivate each other, and the result is a culture of innovation. We are passionate about creating software that helps organizations provide great customer experiences. Our company motto is Faciemus Quae Dicimus, which means We Will Do What We Say – and we stand by it. Upstreamians work hard and play hard, collaborating on solutions and celebrating our successes together. We are a group of modest, dedicated, hard-working, family-friendly, close-knit people who enjoy a flexible work culture, regular employee meetups, and making the extra effort to do what we say we will, and make sure it benefits all of us. Here everyone has the opportunity to make decisions, affect changes and see results right away. You can directly drive the success of the company. At Upstream Works, our values shape everything we do for our partners, our customers, and our team: accountability, collaboration, innovation and excellence. Some of our employee perks include: Health Benefit Spending Account Company Paid Health & Wellness Benefits Gym Membership Discount and Reimbursement Program Employee Stock Option Program Company paid learning & development programs Half day Fridays before every long weekend Extra paid days off for worship and personal days Monthly Employee Meetups, including Axe Throwing, Pizza and Beer Days etc. Mid Day Gaming Breaks, for both remote and in person team members Family and Friends Summer BBQ, including horse back riding, swimming, BBQ, climbing and more! Family and Friends Weekend Getaway Holiday Party Annual Hackathons LOTS of SWAG Movie Nights & Baseball Games And anything else we think sounds like a great idea! Check us out on Facebook, LinkedIn and X (formerly known as Twitter) For those who prefer to work in an office, we are located at 7777 Weston Road, Woodbridge, ON. The office is easily accessible by car or transit (both TTC and York Regional Transit) with free covered parking and a quick walk from the new TTC Vaughan Metropolitan Centre subway station. Awards 2023 Named one of Canada’s Best Employers for Recent Graduates https://reviews.canadastop100.com/top-employer-upstream-works?lang=en#grads Upstream Works recognized as an Innovation Excellence Award 2023 winner by CIO Bulletin https://www.upstreamworks.com/cio-bulletin-announces-upstream-works-as-an-innovation-excellence-award-2023-winner Upstream Works was named one of the Top 20 Innovative AI Solution Providers in 2023 https://www.upstreamworks.com/upstream-works-recognized-by-enterprise-viewpoint The Opportunity: You are a hot shot problem solver, always prepared to stand by your promises and deliver exceptional customer and partner experiences. We are Upstream Works, a Cisco preferred solutions partner, and we provide software technology for customer care in the rapidly changing social, mobile and omnichannel world of the contact center. Our goal is to be the number one agent desktop solutions provider and we are well on our way. We are currently looking for a talented trouble-shooter who will be a key contributor to the success of Upstream Works. Position Summary: Reporting to the Support Manager, the Support Analyst will play a key role in providing support to our customers and deploying our solution for new customers. The successful candidate will be a full-time member of the Support team and will work alongside support staff and senior developers to provide solutions and resolutions to our customers and partners. This job will involve working with experts in Microsoft SQL, Networking, Windows server administration, and Javascript. There's lots of opportunity to learn in these areas from experts in the field. You will be the first line of contact for Upstream Works customers and partners. What you'll do: Be a full-time member of the Support team Provide first level support via phone and email Track issue progress using our JIRA ticketing system Perform remote and occasional onsite technical support Install and configure solutions for customers Maintain an open line of communication with management on current support issues Create and maintain internal Knowledge Base articles Provide emergency on-call support Some travel may be required within North America Assist with organizational IT tasks Coordinate system review with the Infrastructure Analyst (IA) as required Here’s how your support, technical and communication skills come into play: 1 - 2 years of experience in technical or software support. Co-op or internship experience will work as well. Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to prioritize effectively and multitask proactively Outstanding customer service skills Strong troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills Hardware/Software experience with servers and desktops in a Windows environment Solid understanding of Windows (10), Windows Server (2016, and 2019), IIS, VMware, SQL databases As some of our customer’s data is governed by privacy laws, a security check may be required Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as required Undergraduate degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM). New grads are welcome to apply! You are legally entitled to work in Canada Experience with AWS or JavaScript are assets Upstream Works welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Given the evolving COVID-19 situation and its impact on the way we work, Upstream Works is committed to taking every precaution reasonable in the circumstances to provide a healthy and safe environment for all staff members, contractors and visitors. We believe that each employee plays a vital role in preventing the spread of COVID-19 in the workplace. As such, Upstream Works requires all employees to be fully vaccinated and boosted. Successful candidates will be asked to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination status. Information regarding all individual’s vaccination status will only be collected, used, and disclosed exclusively to ensure a safe work environment. It will be stored in a secure location and protected and in accordance with our Privacy Policy and all applicable privacy legislation and regulations. This requirement is subject to the Ontario Human Rights Code or applicable human rights legislations in other Canadian provinces or countries in which Upstream Works operates. Accommodation will be provided to candidates who are legally entitled to accommodation under the human rights legislation such as the Ontario Human Rights Code and applicable human rights legislations in other Canadian provinces or countries in which Upstream works operates. We will continue to stay abreast of all requirements and follow all current Public Health guidelines to protect ourselves and others. Show more Show less

Responsibilities Develop a high-load system for mobile clients; Develop efficient, scalable, performant and "clean" code; Develop new functionality; Expand the team according to the hiring plan; Work with large amounts of data. Requirements At least a 5-year-experience as a Python Developer; Knowledge of database architecture; Knowledge of AWS technology stack: Lambda, RDS, S3, ElastiCache, etc.; Knowledge of design patterns; Keep up with the best practices: Pylint score 9, Test coverage (80%+); Ability to complete tasks quickly, the quest for high quality of a product. FIRMWARE ENGINEER This role is an opportunity to have an exponential impact leading the creation and deployment of transformative technology for real-world impact, and your work will directly contribute to this. As a Firmware Engineer, you will help develop complex solutions that power real-time aerospace systems. Your contributions will directly impact product performance and reliability. You will join a talented, world-class team building breakthrough technologies. A strong ability to thrive in a multidisciplinary team is essential for success. What You’ll Do Develop, test, and optimize firmware for embedded systems, ensuring alignment with industry regulations, privacy, and security standards. Design and implement advanced algorithms for real-time processing and decision-making. Collaborate with hardware and avionics teams to integrate firmware into complex systems. Implement communication protocols to enable seamless data flow between system components. Essential Job Functions Write, test, and debug firmware to ensure functionality, reliability, and scalability. Integrate firmware with sensors, avionics systems, and communication modules. Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure compliance with operational and regulatory standards. Support system architecture decisions, providing insights into firmware implications on hardware and software design. Develop and document robust processes for firmware development, version control, and deployment. Stay current on emerging technologies to drive product innovation. Required Qualifications Proven experience in firmware development for embedded systems, with strong proficiency in C/C++. Expertise in implementing and optimizing communication protocols (e.g., SPI, I2C, CAN, UART, BLE, WIFI). Familiarity with real-time operating systems (RTOS). Knowledge of algorithms for real-time data processing and control. Strong debugging skills using tools like oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and emulators. Excellent communication and documentation skills for cross-functional collaboration. Preferred Qualifications Experience in designing firmware for compliance with aerospace industry standards (e.g., RTCA DO-178C, ISO 9001, SAE AS9100). Familiarity with edge computing and onboard processing for autonomous systems. Expertise in secure firmware development, including encryption, secure boot, and update mechanisms. Knowledge of system architecture for distributed sensor networks. Exposure to machine learning models or AI integration in embedded devices. Pegasus is an equal opportunity employer. Employment with Pegasus is governed on the basis of merit, competence, and qualifications and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Show more Show less

Data Scientist Who We Are Teranet is Canada’s leader in the delivery and transformation of statutory registry services with extensive expertise in land and commercial registries. We also market insightful property and data solutions, as well as practice management automation to thousands of customers in the real estate, financial services, government, utilities, and legal markets. Connect. Grow. Thrive Together. To learn more about who we are visit our website: www.teranet.ca About the Role The Data & Analytics team within the Commercial Solutions line of business has an ambitious mandate, where we are accountable for leveraging Data & Analytics to deliver business value both internally as well as to external clients through the following: Enhance existing or create new products and services with proprietary data assets and partnering with external data providers, through the application of data analytics. Design and deliver custom data solutions to fulfill specific client needs. Explore and analyze data to generate business insights to enhance decision-making. Demonstrate thought leadership in the ecosystem in which we operate. Identify and implement opportunities for operational efficiencies across the organization. This team will play an important role in evangelizing and educating of the value of Data & Analytics to the rest of the organization, in support of cultivating a data-driven culture. The Data Scientist will play a key role in our dynamic team, taking accountability for the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of cutting-edge Machine Learning models. As a vital member of the Data Science team, the role involves collaborating closely on Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) product design and development. The primary focus will be on supporting data products/services and operational efficiency initiatives. This includes a special emphasis on providing tailored products for Financial Solutions business and expanding these capabilities across the organization to address a diverse range of AI needs. Join us in shaping the future of our data-driven initiatives and contributing to innovative solutions that make a meaningful impact. You will be accountable for the entire lifecycle of each assigned ML/AI use case, from gathering business requirements all the way to production and maintenance. You are a self-starter with the ability to think critically. You have experience working in an agile environment and flexible to accommodate evolving deliverables in a challenging and ambitious space. What You’ll Be Doing Data Science and ML modelling (70%) Engage with stakeholders to understand business requirements and objectives of ML/AI use cases. Identify and acquire the best data sources available to meet use case objectives. Explore data to build foundational data knowledge in subject domain, in partnership with data owners. Develop cutting-edge ML models tailored to identified use cases and ensure the accuracy, reliability, and innovation of these models is crucial for making impactful contributions to our data-driven initiatives. Collaborate closely with Data and MLOps Engineers, to implement the models in the Big Data Platform, leveraging cloud technologies. Present technical analyses in a meaningful and intuitive manner, in accordance with the target audience For each use case, thoroughly document the objectives, analysis process, methods, and findings to meet quality standards and production requirements. Continuously monitor and fine tune model performance by evaluating new or revised data sources, modelling techniques, and tools. Identify, evaluate, and manage external vendors for specialized skills. Actively partner with the Data Governance team to ensure that the use of data for each use case complies with Teranet policies and procedures. Contribute to developing Teranet Data & Analytics team to be best-in-class (20%) Be attuned to the latest developments in Data & Analytics, and share learnings and ideas with team to cultivate a spirit of innovation. As a team, develop framework to standardize analysis processes, methodologies, and documentation. Provide feedback and suggestions to enhance and evolve our Analytics program to better meet our corporate goals. Evangelize the value of Data & Analytics at Teranet through engagement with the rest of the organization. Mentoring and coaching junior team members (10%) Delegate data collection, extraction, analysis and/or visualization tasks to more junior members of the team in support of the delivery of the ML/AI use cases Provide direction for and review the assigned work Provide learning and growth opportunities to support the professional development of other team members What you need to be successful: You are someone who: Is keen to understand the business – data science cannot be done in a vacuum – we need to be close to the business so that we understand what we are trying to solve for and what the data means. Tells stories from data – data analytics is not data dump – it needs to be meaningful and intuitive to the end user in order to realize the inherent business value. Challenges the status quo – the state of business and the field of data science are constantly evolving, and we need to as well. Assumptions and old ways of doing things are open season, as long as you bring along workable and relevant solutions articulated in a professional manner. Proactively pursue and learn about new analytical tools and methodologies to solve problems in new and innovative ways. Is good at problem solving – someone who can “connect the dots”, and have a logical and methodical way to tackle new and complex problems. Takes pride in your work – your work is diligent and thorough and you are proud of your reputation for high-quality and reliable work. Is a quick study – the successful candidate must be curious, resourceful, and dig into the weeds to ask the right questions and figure things out independently. Technical qualifications: A Graduate Degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) fields is preferred, with an emphasis on Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science or related disciplines. Equivalent professional experience will be considered. 5+ years of proficiency in Python programming language, with a strong emphasis on machine learning applications. Have a solid track record of 5+ years in creating ML models, especially advanced regression models, utilizing boosting methods and model stacking. Solid understanding of statistical concepts and their application in data science. Experience with cloud architecture (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and PySpark. A significant plus to have proficiency in any/ all the followings: -Spatial Data Science and real estate valuation models -Advanced statistical analysis and economics -Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) for regression analysis Experience with data query languages such as SQL. Skills in data visualization tools, such as Tableau, for effective presentation of analytical findings. Strong knowledge of deep learning techniques and their practical applications. Why Teranet We may be a global innovator in electronic services and solutions who operate one of the most advanced and secure registration systems in the world, but we’re so much more than that! Our Extraordinary People. Growth Opportunities. Our Work Environment. Company Culture & Core Values. What We Offer Market-competitive pay structure​s Paid Vacation & Sick Leaves Maternity, Parental and/or Adoption Leave Top-Up Program 100% Employer-Paid Health Benefit Plan ​ Retirement Savings Plans with Employer Matching Scheme Ongoing Financial Wellness Seminars ​ Corporate Discounted Programs + Wellness Program Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for our employees and their families! At Teranet, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we live and serve. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Come As You Are. We Like You that Way! Show more Show less

Requisition ID: 31200 Note: This job positing is to fill an existing vancany. Do you want to work at one of Hamilton-Niagara's Top Employers and a Canada's Top Employer for Young People ? We’re looking for people who are driven by excellence to work with innovative technology to create the material tomorrow’s world will be made of. At ArcelorMittal Dofasco, we play a key role in North America’s advanced manufacturing supply chain working with the top automotive, energy, packaging, and construction brands to develop lighter, stronger, and more sustainable steel products – from cans to cars. We are embarking on a plan to transform our steelmaking production methods to significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the short term, with the goal of achieving net zero by 2050. Our dedication to revolutionizing steelmaking as part of the climate change solution reinforces our status as a leader in North America ArcelorMittal Dofasco is Hamilton's largest private sector employer with more than 4,500 employees, shipping 4.5 million net tons of high-quality flat carbon steel annually. Our iconic tagline "Our Product is Steel. Our Strength is People.” is a true expression of our belief that our people are our competitive advantage 2025 Summer Student Opportunities Manufacturing Operations Shift Position Background ArcelorMittal Dofasco is now accepting applications for Summer Student positions in various Manufacturing Business Units starting May 2025. Job responsibilities will vary depending on the placement of the student. Successful students will be assigned and required to work in one or more of our Primary or Finishing Manufacturing Business Units. Job Responsibilities May Include Adhere to and fulfill all employee responsibilities set out in the ArcelorMittal Dofasco Health & Safety Policy/Program. Perform daily maintenance and upkeep of production facilities and assets. Operate and handle a variety of handheld tools and materials. Perform administrative support and data entry activities. Actively participate as a member of the team. Perform internal duties as dictated within the department requirements. Support safety and good housekeeping practices. Support department goals and objectives. Manufacturing Operations Participate in daily production activities as a Team Member which may include (but not limited to) the following based on business unit placement: Shoveling coke spillage from the Pusher and Coke side benches. Using a 6 and 12ft scraper to clean door channels and door jambs (sectional cleaning). Operating a scale car to select and weigh the appropriate raw materials to feed the process. Inspect the stock house equipment and process. Reducing the Sulphur content in iron by injecting Calcium carbide and Magnesium into the liquid iron. Managing inventory and ordering of packaging supplies. Strap coils using hand tools/Wrapping coils. Label coils with ID tags and inputting information into shipping tracking system. Basic coil condition inspection. Criteria For Selection Currently enrolled in full-time studies at a university or college and returning to school full-time in September 2025. Must be at least 18 years of age. Must be available to work full time from beginning of May 2025 to end of August 2025. Preference will be given to those students enrolled in post-secondary education closest to graduation and who have not previously worked at ArcelorMittal Dofasco as a Summer Student. Students currently in high school and attending post-secondary in September are not eligible to apply. Students who have previously worked at ArcelorMittal Dofasco as a Summer Student are eligible to apply. Applicants Must Be Able To Wear all required Personal Protective Equipment (Safety glasses, steel toed boots, hard hat, respirator, hearing protection, long sleeves and long pants). May be required to operate equipment such as scissor lifts, pick-up trucks, etc. Work 12 hour rotating shifts. Work at elevated heights. Climb ladders and stairs. Occasional heavy lifting. Use various hand tools. Work indoors and outdoors in elevated temperatures and humidity. Work in environments that may be dusty and noisy. Hours of Work:12 hour rotating shift schedule which will include working days, nights, and alternating weekends. Application Requirements Please ensure all required documents are saved and uploaded as one single file. Failure to include all required documentation will result in your application being excluded from consideration. Resume Proof of enrollment: Current semester timetable (screen shot acceptable), transcript, or proof of application (if returning to a different program) All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, preference will be given to candidates that are direct dependents of ArcelorMittal Dofasco employees. Applications must be submitted no later than January 22, 2025, at 11:59 pm. Requests for late applications will not be accepted. We would like to thank all those who apply in advance. Only applicants selected for next steps will be contacted. ArcelorMittal Dofasco is an equal opportunity employer, and we want everyone to be able to fully participate in our recruitment process. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture, where everyone feels welcomed, valued, respected and heard. We encourage all qualified applicants from all backgrounds and identities to apply and are committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities to support their participation in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Show more Show less

job_summary: Needs to be local to DC/VA/MD area. Exp: 10+ years must Location: Once a month travel to Philadelphia and possibly other train yards for testing (client station locations for testing are Washington, DC, Wilmington, DE, Chicago, IL, New York and Boston). · Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Management, Systems Engineering, or other related field or 4+ years of relevant work experience required to satisfy education/experience requirements. · Strong written and verbal communication skills, and the capability to present confidently to project teams. · Strong interpersonal and team-building skills, work well with others in an integrated team environment and must be self-motivated. · Solid analytical and problem-solving skills. Broad knowledge of multiple computer environments, platforms, and technologies. · Strong understanding of how backend systems (OS, APP, DB, Network) work. · Experience defining and documenting business process maps (swim lane format preferred), business/functional requirements, use cases, user stories, technical specifications, test plans, test cases, test scripts, and test results. · Broad knowledge of a variety of collaboration, requirements, testing, and support methodologies. · Solid knowledge of Agile methodologies (SCRUM/SAFE) and techniques. · Ability to create and document Client Project Life Cycle Management (PLM) artifacts and key process steps. · Ability to do troubleshooting for software and related hardware components for the OnBoard Information System. · Identify errors or deficiencies in the hardware and software components. · Training will be provided but a solid proven background is required to effectively absorb the knowledge and skills to take this project forward with the ability to challenge the vendor when necessary but also be able to work alongside the vendor to deploy solid solutions. · Strong skills in Microsoft Office 365 including Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Project, and Visio. Skills with tool sets including Jira, Confluence, BitBucket, and Service Now . Fast-paced, high visibility environment. Show more Show less

We are seeking a skilled Solution Architect with extensive experience in eCommerce, retail application architecture, and integration development. The ideal candidate will evaluate business requirements and design customized, efficient solutions that align with our strategic objectives. Expertise in working with various CRM systems is essential. Key Requirements: Architect and develop scalable B2B and B2C eCommerce platforms, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Provide architectural direction for building secure and high-performance online stores. Perform object-oriented analysis and Java/J2EE design to create effective solutions. Translate business needs into actionable and well-structured system architecture designs. Ensure all solutions adhere to security standards and deliver optimal performance for high availability. job_title: Industry Sales Manager, Behavioral Health & Treatment Solutions
job_summary: Industry Sales Manager, Behavioral Health & Treatment Solutions Job Type: Full-time Kaysville, UT and Remote (United States Only) Who We Are: At Bark, we’re on a mission to keep children safer online – both at home and at school. We use cutting-edge machine-learning technology to detect issues like cyberbullying, sexting, signs of depression, suicidal ideation, and more. We also offer internet filtering and screen time limits. Learn more at www.bark.us . We are seeking an entrepreneurial and results-driven Industry Sales Manager to lead sales efforts in a new and experimental vertical for Bark in the behavioral health and treatment solutions industry. This role offers a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of launching Bark’s expansion into mid-sized and large enterprises in the healthcare industry, including public health systems, private treatment facilities, residential treatment, substance abuse disorder programs, and outpatient behavioral health services. The ideal candidate will thrive in ambiguity, demonstrate a passion for building new markets, and be excited about crafting tailored solutions to establish Bark as a trusted partner in this emerging industry. Job Responsibilities: Relationship Development Build and maintain relationships with decision-makers across key behavioral health subcategories, including residential treatment facilities, substance abuse disorder programs, outpatient behavioral health services and other specialized therapy practices Act as a trusted advisor by understanding customer needs and aligning Bark’s solutions to their strategic goals. Pipeline Development & Sales Execution Identify and engage potential customers through proactive outbound prospecting and lead generation efforts. Build and manage a robust sales pipeline to meet and exceed revenue goals. Execute the full sales cycle, including discovery, tailored solution presentation, proposal development, negotiation, and closing. Field Sales & Industry Engagement Represent Bark at industry conferences, trade shows, and networking events to build brand visibility and identify opportunities. Leverage field sales strategies to engage with prospects in their environments, deepening relationships and driving deal closure. Vertical Development Collaborate with leadership to shape Bark’s go-to-market strategy for this new vertical, providing insights and feedback from the field to refine offerings. Partner with internal teams to adapt and evolve Bark’s value proposition for the behavioral health and treatment industry. Be a thought partner in developing sales playbooks, collateral, and processes specific to this vertical. Requirements: Experience: 5–7 years of B2B sales experience with a proven track record of selling to mid-sized and large enterprises. Experience in solution selling, ideally within behavioral health, healthcare, or treatment-focused industries. Experience selling to public health systems, private treatment facilities, or behavioral therapy providers (e.g., residential treatment or substance abuse programs) is highly desirable. A passion for building and driving success in new, experimental markets. Skills: Strong outbound prospecting skills, including cold outreach and account targeting. Excellent consultative selling skills with the ability to navigate complex sales cycles and tailor solutions to customer needs. Proven ability to leverage field sales strategies and conference attendance to build relationships and drive pipeline growth. Collaboration: Experience working cross-functionally with marketing, product, and customer success teams to align sales efforts and provide valuable market feedback. Tools: Proficiency with CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and a data-driven approach to pipeline management and strategy optimization. Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with experience crafting and delivering impactful presentations and proposals. What We’re Looking For: A self-starter who thrives in new and ambiguous environments and is excited to help Bark define its place in the behavioral health and treatment space. A creative thinker who can adapt to the unique challenges of building a new vertical and develop innovative approaches to sales and relationship management. A passionate advocate for Bark’s mission, with the drive to create meaningful partnerships in an industry focused on improving lives. Benefits: Competitive compensation commensurate with experience Equity stake in Bark Paid time off Paid sick time Health Benefits: Medical Dental Vision Healthcare Support On-Demand Primary Care Online Mental Health Therapy Flexible Spending Account (FSA) Supplemental Life Insurance 401(k) Voluntary Long-term and Short-term Disability Insurance Next Steps: Please be sure to add notifications@app.bamboohr.com to your contact list to ensure delivery of all correspondence from us. We recognize people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process. Bark is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Join Our Team as Director of Human Resources Are you a strategic HR leader passionate about driving organizational success and fostering a high-performance culture? Quality Management Group (QMG) is seeking an innovative and dynamic Director of Human Resources to join our team during an exciting growth phase. As the Director of HR, you will be a strategic business partner within our leadership team and report to the President. Leading a dedicated and experienced team of HR professionals you will shape our HR strategy, ensure compliance, and implement initiatives that support our mission and values. You will lead key performance objectives, which include strategic planning, enhanced recruitment efficiency, expanded training and field empowerment, continuing to foster a customer service-focused HR culture, integrating core values, and elevating employee engagement. This role is replacing our esteemed Director of HR who is retiring after many years. Key Performance Objectives (KPOs): Develop a strategic plan and metrics for the following KPOs within 90 days. Ensure full compliance with employment laws, focusing on California Wage and Hour. Improve recruitment efficiency including reduce time to hire to 30 days or less and increase offer acceptance rates. Integrate core values into onboarding, training, and performance review processes before year end across the organization. Develop and deploy effective training programs for all managers/supervisors, leveraging AI and self-service query/training tools. Maintain a customer service-focused HR culture and continuously improve support and services. Boost employee engagement, morale, and retention with targeted initiatives. Why Join QMG? Impact: Shape and drive our HR strategy, directly influencing company success and culture. Growth: Tackle diverse HR challenges and opportunities for continuous learning and professional development. Leadership: Serve as a strategic business partner and mentor, shaping the future of our HR department. Values: Work for a company that values Trust, Respect, Development, Adaptability, and Sustainability. Collaboration: Engage in a supportive work culture that emphasizes teamwork, innovation, and employee empowerment. Join us at QMG and make a meaningful impact on our organization and community. Apply today to be part of a dynamic leadership team dedicated to growth and excellence. Please provide your resume and a cover letter outlining one achievement that is related to each of the KPOs outlined above along with what you are looking for in your next career move. Applications will be accepted throughout July and interviews will begin mid to late July. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
