Who We Are: Velocity Vehicle Group (VVG) is a premium commercial brand medium to heavy truck dealership that offers the full-service experience for our customers, from an outstanding sales organization to highly skilled technicians to service your vehicle, and on demand parts. Our goal is to be your one stop shop experts for all truckers, owner operators, fleets, and companies. This coupled with our Leasing and Rental business and our Financial services business make VVG the leading Truck dealership. What’s in it for You: Velocity Vehicle Group is a dynamic and rapidly expanding organization, and we're on the lookout for individuals who relish daily challenges and are passionate about delivering top-notch customer service, both within the company and to our valued clients. When you join VVG, you'll experience an extraordinary work environment, complete with competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package, including 401K with matching, as well as Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage. Become a part of our team and immerse yourself in a company that fosters a Great Place to Work™ culture! Essential Functions and Purpose: The Benefits Manager plays a crucial role in ensuring that employee benefit plans are administered effectively and in alignment with service level expectations. This involves maintaining strong relationships with brokers to oversee global benefit and wellness plans, ensuring they meet client needs. Additionally, the Benefits Manager is responsible for managing all leave of absence processes and conducting audits to mitigate business risks, working closely with HR Business Partner team and third-party administrators (TPAs) to ensure compliance with relevant regulations. The Benefits Manager will be responsible for wellness initiatives and oversee the management of retirement plans, such as 401(k) and RRSP, collaborating with brokers and auditors to ensure these plans are compliant and annual audits are processed smoothly. To excel in this role, a deep understanding of employment laws and regulations related to leaves and benefit management is essential, enabling the Benefits Manager to navigate complex legal landscapes and ensure the company remains compliant. This position requires a proactive approach to problem-solving and a keen eye for detail to maintain the integrity and effectiveness of the company's benefits programs. Principal Responsibilities: Administer Employee Benefit Plans: Oversee the effective administration of global employee benefit plans, ensuring they align with service level expectations and meet the needs of employees. Broker Relationship Management: Maintain and strengthen relationships with brokers to ensure benefit plans are effectively managed and compliant with company standards. Leave of Absence Management: Manage all leave of absence processes and case management, ensuring compliance with relevant employment laws and regulations. Wellness Program Development: Design and implement comprehensive wellness programs that promote employee health and well-being, aligning with company goals and employee needs. This includes identifying and collaborating with external wellness vendors and resources to offer a variety of wellness activities and initiatives. Risk Mitigation and Auditing: Conduct regular audits of benefit plans (FSA, HSA, etc.) and leave processes to identify and mitigate potential business risks. Third-Party Administrator Coordination: Collaborate with third-party administrators (TPAs) to ensure compliance with benefit-related regulations and efficient plan administration. Retirement Plan Oversight: Oversee the management of retirement plans, such as 401(k) and RRSP, ensuring they are compliant with legal requirements and company policies. Audit Collaboration: Partner with auditors to facilitate the smooth processing of annual audits for benefit and retirement plans. Regulatory Compliance: Stay informed about employment laws and regulations related to benefits and leaves, ensuring the company remains compliant. Problem-Solving and Issue Resolution: Proactively address and resolve issues related to benefit plans and leave management, maintaining the integrity of the programs. Policy Development and Implementation: Develop and implement policies and procedures related to benefits and leave management, ensuring they are up-to-date and effective. Employee Communication and Support: Provide clear communication and support to employees regarding their benefits and leave options, addressing any questions or concerns. Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyze data related to benefit plan usage and effectiveness, providing reports and recommendations for improvements to senior HR management. Required Qualifications: Four years of experience in HR Benefits Department. Four years of experience in managing leave cases FMLA, ADA and STD. Extensive knowledge of applicable federal and state employment laws (FMLA, CFRA, ADA, USERRA, etc.). Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Physical Requirements: Must be able to pass post offer drug test, and physical Compensation: Exempt $75K-$95K depending on experience and qualifications Plus Bonus Full Time position Benefits Velocity Vehicle Group Offers: Fantastic Culture 401k + match Health, Dental & Vision Insurance + HSA & FSA Employer paid Life Insurance Paid Vacation Days Sick Leave Excellent Training and Career Advancement Opportunities Company perks such as employee discounts, company events and training programs Velocity Vehicle Group is an equal opportunity employer. Velocity Vehicle Group prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. job_summary: Job Title: Junior Software Developer Location: Taylorsville, NC (Charlotte, NC area) Position Type: Full-Time, Manufacturing, IT, Programming, Developer, Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 R3 About Surya Inc. At Surya Inc., we are redefining the world of interior design. As a leading furnishings company, we offer a thoughtfully curated collection of design-forward furniture, rugs, textiles, lighting, wall decor, and accents. Our products are available globally through interior designers, architects, procurement firms, and more. Surya Inc. proudly includes renowned brands such as Surya, Global Views, Mitchell Gold + Bob Williams, Livabliss, and RST Brands. We’ve been honored ten times on the Inc. 5000 list of America's fastest-growing privately held companies. What You Will Be Doing As a Junior Software Developer, you’ll play an integral role in the growth and enhancement of our Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 R3 ERP systems. You will work closely with a dynamic team to support the ongoing development of business solutions in a manufacturing environment. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience, learn new technologies, and apply your skills to real-world challenges. Assist in supporting and enhancing our Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 R3 ERP systems. Collaborate with AX developers to translate business and functional requirements into technical solutions. Work in a team-oriented, supportive manufacturing environment where you can learn and grow. Gain exposure to a range of development technologies while building your technical expertise. What We Are Looking For: We are seeking a motivated, eager-to-learn developer who thrives in a collaborative environment. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, you’ll fit right in! Required: Associate’s Degree in Computer Science or related field (Bachelor's Degree preferred). Strong experience with Microsoft Dynamics AX development using object-oriented programming languages such as Java, C#, Visual Studio, .NET, etc. Solid understanding of SDLC processes and IT best practices, with hands-on experience in analysis, design, and coding. Proficiency in SQL. Experience with MS Office suite. Preferred Skills: Experience with eCommerce and/or Retail POS systems is a plus. Compensation & Benefits: We offer a competitive compensation package and a variety of benefits to support your overall well-being and career growth: Competitive salary. 401k with company match. Health (medical, dental) insurance options. A collaborative, team-driven environment with plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth. If you're passionate, driven, and ready to make an impact, we’d love to have you on our team! Whatever you do, you'll make a difference at Lafarge Canada. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. Thanks to our teams' energy, commitment and ideas, we are reinventing how the world builds to make Canada greener and smarter for all. Senior Developer - Data & Analytics Requisition ID: 10759 Location: Calgary, AB, CA, T2C 5G9 Mississauga, ON, CA, L4V 1S7 Pay Type: Salary WHO IS LAFARGE? As a global leader in innovative and sustainable building solutions, Lafarge is enabling greener cities, smarter infrastructure and improving living standards around the world. With sustainability at the core of our strategy, we are becoming a net-zero company, with our people and communities at the heart of our success. We are driving circular construction as a world leader in recycling to build more with less. It’s all thanks to our 70,000 talented people around the world who are passionate about building progress for people and the planet through four business segments: Cement, Ready-Mix Concrete, Aggregates and Solutions & Products. WHO ARE LAFARGE PEOPLE? Lafarge people are passionate about finding better ways to build. They embrace innovation and improvement with a pioneering spirit. They work as trusted partners, creating better solutions and experiences for their customers, communities, and colleagues. About The Role We are looking for a Senior Developer - Data and Analytics to join our team and support our newly implemented Datasphere (formerly Data Warehouse Cloud) platform. This role will be tasked with developing and maintaining: data models, ETL configurations, and other data assets in Datasphere. This role will interact with teams from various departments throughout North America and may work in a remote or hybrid fashion depending on the applicants preference. Datasphere is our main data warehousing platform. SAP Analytics Cloud is our visualization front-end that is integrated with Datasphere. What You'll Be Doing Design, implement, and maintain complex: data models, data schema, and structures in Datasphere to meet business requirements Create complex views and ETL/ELT transformations using: the Datasphere graphical interface, SQL, Python, and scripting capabilities Provide end-to-end expertise in Datasphere to support the delivery of business requirements in SAP Analytics Cloud (visualization front-end) and other reporting platforms, in North America, that will connect to Datasphere Serve as the SME for the Datasphere platform to proactively identify potential issues, solutions, and improvements to keep business processes running as smoothly and seamlessly as possible Gain an in-depth understanding of data sources feeding into Datasphere (SAP ERPs and other systems) to decide on the appropriate joins and relationships and create data models, based on these data sources to meet business requirements (primarily in the SAP Analytics Cloud visualization tool). Proactively suggest improvements to existing data models and transformations already developed in Datasphere Ensure that all data assets developed in Datasphere are developed with performance, scalability, and accuracy in mind (handling millions/billions of records across various source tables). Collaborate with IT to ensure proper lifecycle management of newly developed and existing assets in Datasphere Monitor data performance and remediate issues with query and data processing performance as necessary to achieve quick and efficient response times in data models Stay up to date on changes and updates in the SAP Datasphere software via: following the SAP Product Roadmap and attending trainings, seminars, and other offerings by SAP as necessary. Maintain an understanding on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and other key company metrics to be sure that data models and data assets developed in Datasphere align with business requirements Other duties as assigned. Relationships With Other Jobs Collaborate with SAP Analytics Cloud Administrators/Developers and IT to understand and deliver data modeling requirements in Datasphere Collaborate with IT, Finance, and Commercial teams to understand the diverse needs of the organization and context behind the requested data models, data assets, and related calculations in Datasphere What We Are Looking For Education: Bachelor's degree or years of equivalent experience Additional Education Preferred: Field of Study Preferred: Information Technology, Analytics, Data, Finance/Accounting, or related field of study Required Work Experience: 8 to 10 years of experience. Required Training/Certifications: Certifications in SAP Analytics Cloud, Datasphere, SQL, or Python are a plus Licenses Preferred: SAP Licenses/Certifications related to SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere Required Computer and Software Skills: Experience in any number of the following tools (understanding that Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud are the tools that our team actively uses). Since the popularity of certain BI and Data Warehousing solutions change over time, and all BI and Data Warehousing tools are conceptually similar, training will be offered as necessary should the applicant have general experience in BI and Data but not SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere specifically. SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Datasphere SAP Business Planning and Consolidation (BPC), SAP Business Objects, PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, SQL, Python, Scripting, APIs, JSON, OData connections, SAP HANA Databases etc. Travel Requirements: 25% Additional Requirements: Highly visible senior role that requires independence and ability to make decisions using one’s own expertise Strong knowledge of BI, Data Warehousing, and related best practices including knowledge of: SQL, Python, ETL/ELT, scripting, and other coding languages commonly used by BI/Data professionals. Experience in working with Datasphere or BW HANA, third party data sources, or other data warehousing platforms. Understanding of data governance, data privacy, legal, and other principles surrounding data. Demonstrate a commitment to communicating, improving and adhering to health, safety and environmental policies in all work environments and areas. Promote a culture of safety and exhibit these behaviors. Successful candidates must adhere to all safety protocols and proper use of Holcim approved Personal Protection Equipment ("PPE"), including but not limited to respirators. Subject to applicable law, employees that are required to wear respirators must be clean-shaven where the respirator seal meets the face in order to pass the qualitative and quantitative fit tests. Demonstrate a commitment to communicating, improving and adhering to health, safety and environmental policies in all work environments and areas. Promote a culture of safety and exhibit these behaviors. Your Lafarge Experience At Lafarge, there is endless opportunity for you to play your part. Whether you’re in a technical, managerial, or frontline role, you can shape a career that works for you. With us you’ll have the chance to embrace the passion we share for our planet. You’ll be encouraged to seek out diverse perspectives, share your ideas and build the skills and connections you need to perform at your best. Because it’s only when we work together in a culture where everyone thrives, that we can build the world we all want to live in. Show more Show less

job_summary: The Company Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software, and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality, and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector, and mobility applications. Our technologies are shaping the production and people-related ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous — ensuring a scalable, sustainable future. Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 24,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 5.5bn USD. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB. Purpose Of Position As a DevOps Engineer, you will work closely with a team of architects, engineers, and developers to build, maintain, and deploy reference architectures and operational systems for both cloud and on premise systems. You will make sure to follow security best practices and design security into everything you do. You will be a key driver in the automation and monitoring of processes, services and deployments and will utilize modern DevSecOps principles such as Infrastructure as Code and Containerization for the Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment of our Applications and Infrastructure. Major Areas Of Responsibility Build, deploy, and manage secure and scalable cloud infrastructure using Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or similar. Develop Infrastructure as Code for repeatable and scalable infrastructure using industry standards like Terraform Design and Implement CI/CD Pipelines using Atlassian Bamboo and ArgoCD for both infrastructure and product deployment Automate processes and deployments of applications and infrastructure using Kubernetes and containerization Implement monitoring, management processes, and disaster recovery for operations to provide high availability and ensure scalability. Enforce security best practices and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations, safeguarding sensitive data and intellectual property. Knowledge And Experience - Required Bachelors degree in Engineering (Computer or Electrical preferred) or Computer Science or the equivalent work experience Strong knowledge of Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment and DevOps principles Experience managing, developing, and deploying cloud infrastructure using Terraform. Azure ARM/Bicep or AWS CloudFormation experience a plus. 2 plus years experience with containerization and deployment using Kubernetes and Docker 2 plus years experience building CI/CD pipelines using any industry standard toolchain Knowledge of Prometheus and Grafana for observability and monitoring Proficiency in scripting and automation tools such as Linux Bash, PowerShell and Python Knowledge of Cybersecurity industry standards such as NIST or CIS. Knowledge And Experience - Desired Relevant certifications in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP are a plus. Relevant certifications for tools such as the "Certified Kubernetes Administrator" or "Prometheus Certified Associate" are a plus Relevant certifications in Cybersecurity are a plus. Knowledge of Agile development methodologies a plus. Past development experience using a language such as C++, C#, Python or Javascript is a plus Knowledge of Atlassian Bamboo, Atlassian Bitbucket, Atlassian Jira, and JFrog Artifactory are a plus. Travel Very minimal internal travel may be occasionally required. Language Fluent English (written and verbal) is a prerequisite. Benefits Hexagon is committed to helping our employees thrive as they balance their work and life. We offer competitive pay and incentive-based bonuses. Our comprehensive benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, retirement savings with company matching, life insurance, disability, mental health support, and much more. For your continued learning and professional development, we provide education assistance, funding for professional association memberships, mentorship programs, and access to tools and resources to move your career forward. We maintain a positive and comfortable work environment, with employee-led social clubs, and flexible schedules. Some benefits offered are dependent if you are hired on as full-time, part-time, or temporary status. Hexagon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We prohibit discrimination against any job applicant based on protected characteristics. Show more Show less

D3 Search is actively recruiting a Regional Human Resources Manager for a highly respected international AMLAW ranked practice with an office located in Los Angeles, CA (90071) Position Title: Regional Human Resources Manager Note: 5+ years previous HR experience in a law firm or professional services setting or a combination of experience and education is REQUIRED. Location/Map: Los Angeles, CA (90071) Employment Status: Full-time | direct hire employment opportunity. Exempt role. Employer Work Model: Flexible hybrid 3/2 work model. Role Summary: Under direction of the Director of Administration and the Director of Human Resources, the Regional Human Resources Manager performs a variety of recruiting and generalist duties for the firm’s four (4) California offices (Los Angeles, Century City, San Francisco, and Silicon Valley), including the interviewing and selection of candidates, conducting new hire orientation, evaluating the workflow of legal administrative assistant pairings, performance evaluations, and performance management. Responsible for the coordination with Payroll and Benefits for the overall administration of salary information, administration, and communication of information regarding the health, welfare, wellness and retirement plans. The successful candidate will be able to execute, interpret, and implement local, California and Federal labor laws in compliance with firm standards, have strong organizational skills, meticulous attention to detail and accuracy; excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to multitask and thrive under tight deadlines. Essential Duties: Must understand and apply Federal, State and local CA employment laws. Monitor and coordinate appropriate legal administrative assistant staffing ratios and workflow. Confer with attorneys, paralegals and legal administrative assistants regarding assignments, performance problems and need for additional training. Monitor and approve administrative overtime worked by legal administrative assistants. Manage all aspects of recruiting including posting positions to the firm website, reviewing resumes, conducting & coordinating the interview process, processing background checks & references, testing, sending an offer letter and receiving final approval for hire. Coordinate & conduct New Hire Orientation for new hires for all California offices. Work with broader HR team on a wide variety of global HR initiatives and projects across multiple HR disciplines, including, but not limited to: compensation, diversity and inclusion, governance and policy, change management, talent management, performance management, HRIS, and acquisition integration. Works closely with the firm-wide Benefits Department in Atlanta to provide information to lawyers and staff in the California offices to ensure that benefit programs are administered in accordance with established procedure. Conduct exit interviews, as assigned, for administrative staff. Coordinate educational workshops including dates, topics, and the tracking of attendance. Manage the annual professional staff review process for the California offices. Attend HR department meetings. Recognize potential legal issues (e.g. sexual harassment, discrimination, termination) and discuss with appropriate resources for direction and guidance. Work closely with the firm-wide Administrative Officers, Directors, and Managers to ensure that firm-wide practices and procedures are followed. Serve as a member of the Firm’s Executive Staff. Maintains all employee's employment records and files in an organized and accurate manner. Manages timekeeping activities for the office, including ensuring all timecards are approved, answering questions about timekeeping and coordinate with Payroll, as necessary. Skills Needed To Be Successful: Minimum of 5 years’ previous HR experience in a law firm or professional services setting or a combination of experience and education. Previous supervisory experience of 3-5 years in a related environment, preferred. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Demonstrates teamwork, creativity, a desire for continuous improvement, and commitment to the profession. Commitment to providing superior customer service. Ability to interact effectively with people at all levels of the firm. Thorough organizational skills for prioritizing workload and recruiting efforts. Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to work under pressure, and deal with demanding deadlines; strong attention to detail and team-oriented attitude. Thorough knowledge of Firm systems and procedures to efficiently meet Firm personnel demands. Advanced technical skills including prior experience with recruiting software and HRIS systems. Eduction: Bachelor’s degree in related field PHR, PHRca, SPHR, SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP certification strongly desired. Salary/Compensation: Annual salary range is up to 170K (DOE/DOQ). Health Benefits Summary: Comprehensive health benefits package, generous PTO, 401K, paid parking onsite, annual salary increases and lucrative bonuses (based on individual merit & performance), and many other employee-centered perks, etc. Highly collaborative, collegial and supportive work environment. If interested in this full-time/direct hire Regional Human Resources Manager role with this highly respected international AMLAW ranked law practice located in Los Angeles, CA (90071), and you meet the above qualifications/requirements, please contact the following D3 rep.: Domenic Ferrante | D3 Search 📬domenic@d3search.com 📌 www.d3search.com D3 Legal Search LLC (aka D3 Search), and its clients are equal opportunity employers. Pursuant to local ordinances, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. job_summary: UKG Systems Admin 2 year contract Part time 25-30 hours Onsite hybrid This consultant will be a key project team member for the UKG enterprise rollout effort and provide production support/break-fix for our critical United Kronos Group (UKG) TELESTAFF and PROWFM scheduling, timekeeping, and payroll system(s). This consultant will help implement these above systems , while also support departments/users who are already using these systems in production. This consultant will perform the following roles for the UKG PROWFM and TELESTAFF systems: 1. System Analyst/Designer 2. Global System Administrator 3. Production Support – Break/Fix support The consultant will be a key part of the project team to rollout UKG to various departments. In addition, they’ll support Finance and 4 additional departments who are already “live” and using these systems in production. Must have: • Excellent communications skills, written and verbal. • Strong system analysis and design skills. • Strong system documentation skills (requirements, current and future state, etc.). • Strong collaboration and facilitation skills; ability to work with large project teams, small groups, and individuals to discuss and trouble-shoot requests/issues; design system solutions and meet changing business requirements. • Experience supporting UKG PROWFM and TELESTAFF for complex, union-based organizations (e.g., airports, cities, municipalities, etc.) • 2 – 5 Years experience implementing/supporting UKG PROWFM (formerly Dimensions) and TELESTAFF scheduling and time reporting/payroll systems. • 2 – 5 Years experience as a System Administrator for UKG PROWFM (formerly Dimensions) for scheduling, time reporting, and payroll processing. • 2-5 Years experience as a System Administrator/Analyst for UKG TELESTAFF Scheduling. The projected hourly range for this position is $80/hr and $105/hr. On-Demand Group (ODG) provides employee benefits which includes healthcare, dental, and vision insurance. ODG is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. MANAGER OF BENEFITS Reporting to the Director of Benefits & Records, this role is strategically positioned to have positive impact across all levels of RAND. As Manager of Benefits, you will be pivotal in designing, implementing, and managing employee benefits and retirement programs to support RAND’s staff with their physical, mental, emotional, financial, and social well-being. You will be responsible for ensuring that staff have access to comprehensive and competitive benefits that align with the total rewards strategy, along with resources to promote their overall well-being. This role requires an in-depth understanding of benefits administration, time off and leave programs, project and vendor management, and compliance, along with the ability to communicate health, welfare, wellness, and retirement programs. This position is vital in maintaining a positive employee experience and supporting RAND’s commitment to overall well-being. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: May perform any or all of the following duties: Designs, manages, implements, and administers well-crafted benefit programs and initiatives that support leaders and various groups of benefit-eligible staff as applicable and assists with requests for proposals while considering benchmarking, legal and regulatory developments, and cost considerations. Recommends changes to plan design and administration that align with organizational objectives. Oversees administration and coordination of time off and leave programs including disability, FMLA, company-paid Birth Recovery and Parental (Bonding) leaves, Paid Family Leave, Workers’ Compensation, and state sick leave. Builds strategic and effective relationships with internal stakeholders/business leaders and external consultants and benefit vendors to support total rewards initiatives. Assists with managing RAND’s 35+ vendors and partners to promote effective benefits delivery, including implementing plan design changes, resolving operational issues, monitoring reporting and adherence of service-level agreements, and evaluating scorecards. Leads annual open enrollment process including, but not limited to, updating Workday system with plan and rule changes, coordinating with consultants and vendors on data feeds and required documentation, originating virtual and/or onsite benefit fairs, developing related communications, and educating Benefits team and staff on changes. Acts as an internal consultant to the business, working with leaders, HR, and other key stakeholders to understand how our benefits support their needs, the RAND mission, and implements suitable solutions. Provides ongoing support and guidance to managers to promote a culture of total rewards mindset across all levels of the organization. Develops metrics and benchmarking for various benefit processes and programs. Collaborates and coordinates with internal Workday Service Center team and external vendors to ensure system and data integrations are developed and enhanced to ensure effective user experiences. Ensures benefit plans, programs, and policies remain in compliance with legal and regulatory requirements; remains abreast of legal and regulatory developments and industry best practices. Leads, develops, and implements effective communication strategies that drive engagement and educates staff about company benefits programs. Works with internal partners and subject matter experts to develop customized and applicable educational programs that align with the needs and interests of multiple departments, groups, and staff levels. Manages employees to deliver strong performance; establish performance expectations; train and develop team by providing timely recognition, feedback, coaching, and support; assist with problem solving and guidance; allocate resources effectively to equitably distribute the workload while also identifying appropriate skill levels and talents; and support a safe work environment. QUALIFICATIONS: KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS: People Manager Manages employees to deliver strong performance; establish performance expectations; train and develop team by providing timely recognition, feedback, coaching, and support; assist with problem solving and guidance; allocate resources effectively to equitably distribute the workload while also identifying appropriate skill levels and talents; and support a safe work environment. Benefits Management Designs, manages, implements, and administers well-crafted benefit programs and initiatives that support leaders and various groups of benefit-eligible staff as applicable and assists with requests for proposals while considering benchmarking, legal and regulatory developments, and cost considerations. Recommends changes to plan design and administration that align with organizational objectives. Oversees administration and coordination of time off and leave programs including disability, FMLA, company-paid Birth Recovery and Parental (Bonding) leaves, Paid Family Leave, Workers’ Compensation, and state sick leave. Develops metrics and benchmarking for various benefit processes and programs. Vendor and Relationship Management Builds strategic and effective relationships with internal stakeholders/business leaders and external consultants and benefit vendors to support total rewards initiatives. Assists with managing RAND’s 35+ vendors and partners to promote effective benefits delivery, including implementing plan design changes, resolving operational issues, monitoring reporting and adherence of service-level agreements, and evaluating scorecards. Acts as an internal consultant to the business, working with leaders, HR, and other key stakeholders to understand how our benefits support their needs, the RAND mission, and implements suitable solutions. Provides ongoing support and guidance to managers to promote a culture of total rewards mindset across all levels of the organization. Systems/Technical Leads annual open enrollment process including, but not limited to, updating Workday system with plan and rule changes, coordinating with consultants and vendors on data feeds and required documentation, and originating virtual and/or onsite benefit fairs. Collaborates and coordinates with internal Workday Service Center team and external vendors to ensure system and data integrations are developed and enhanced to ensure effective user experiences. Ensures benefit plans, programs, and policies remain in compliance with legal and regulatory requirements; remains abreast of legal and regulatory developments and industry best practices. Communications and Education Leads, develops, and implements effective communication strategies that drive engagement and educates staff about company benefits programs to include open enrollment changes and system-related updates. Works with internal partners and subject matter experts to develop customized and applicable educational programs that align with the needs and interests of multiple departments, groups, and staff levels. EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree required; advanced degree preferred. Professional designations (CEBS, GBA, RPA, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP) desired. EXPERIENCE 8+ years of progressively responsible HR experience including 10 years in management Proficient in Microsoft Office and experience with Workday benefits, absence modules, and vendor integration files. Exceptional communication skills, and able to demonstrate credibility to key stakeholders in both written and verbal communication. Strong analytic skills and ability to interpret data are required. Demonstrated knowledge of employee health, disability, wellness, and retirement programs and plans, including processes, procedures, and benefit contract language. Knowledge of all pertinent federal and state regulations, filing and compliance requirements both adopted and pending affecting employee benefit and time off programs, retirement plans, including ERISA, COBRA, FMLA, ADA, ACA, Section 125, Workers’ Compensation, and Secure 2.0. LOCATION(S) Santa Monica, CA; Washington DC (Arlington, VA); and Pittsburgh, PA. Occasional travel within the U.S. is required. Show more Show less

job_summary: Token Metrics is seeking a multi-talented Smart Contract Engineer to facilitate the operations of our Engineering team. As a Smart Contract Engineer, you will closely collaborate with fellow engineers and product managers to build infrastructure to bring Token Metrics privacy and scalability infrastructure to the Ethereum ecosystem. Examples of work include building a cross-chain bridge for moving assets, and implementing a Solidity smart contract to validate blocks for a private and auditable transaction system on Token Metrics. Responsibilities Design, implement, test, and deploy EVM smart contracts Work with external auditors to evaluate security and safety of smart contracts Take engineering projects from concept and design to production, while working with engineering leaders and the product team to create sound and realistic roadmaps. Requirements 3+ years of professional software engineering experience or equivalent blockchain/smart contract development experience Proficiency developing in Solidity; familiarity with precompiles Understanding of software engineering and security best practices, in particular smart contract security Experience interacting with dapps/web3 Experience shipping and taking engineering projects to production. About Token Metrics Token Metrics helps crypto investors build profitable portfolios using artificial intelligence-based crypto indices, rankings, and price predictions. Token Metrics has a diverse set of customers, from retail investors and traders to crypto fund managers, in more than 50 countries. PI260335263 Show more Show less

Golang Engineer - New York, NY 12-month contract (extensions up to 5 years) | W2/1099/C2C Available Our client, a top 10 global U.S. financial services organization, is hiring more than 10 new contract Golang Engineers. You will be focused on building and executing against a strategy and roadmap focused on moving from monolithic, tightly coupled, batch-based legacy platforms to a loosely coupled, event-driven, microservices-based architecture to meet our long-term business goals. Responsibilities Responsible for designing system solutions, developing custom applications, and modifying existing applications to meet distinct and changing business requirements. Handle coding, debugging, and documentation, as well working closely with SRE team. Provide post implementation and ongoing production support Develop and design software applications, translating user needs into system architecture. Assess and validate application performance and integration of component systems and provide process flow diagrams. Test the engineering resilience of software and automation tools. Identify innovative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers. Play a critical role partnering with other development teams, testing and quality, and production support, to meet implementation dates and allow smooth transition throughout the development lifecycle. Requirements A minimum of 4 years of experience in a modern development stack including Golang, Kafka and REST APIs. Experience in application design, software development, and testing in an Agile environment. Experience with relational and NoSQL databases, including PostgreSQL, Couchbase, or Cassandra. Experience designing and developing REST APIs for high volume clients. Experience with continuous integration tools (Jenkins, Gitlab CI). Experience with automated build and test frameworks a plus. Experience with container and container orchestration technologies (Docker and Kubernetes). Experience with Atlassian software development and collaboration tools (JIRA, Confluence etc). These positions are available on an initial 12-month contract which will be reviewed and extended year on year up to 5 years+. This contract offers a hybrid working arrangement, with 2-3 days per week in the New York, NY office and 2-3 days per week working from home. W2, 1099, and C2C options considered. Please apply online for consideration. Show more Show less

job_summary: Job Title: Datastage Developer Location : Toronto, ON (Hybrid – 3 days a week in the office) Industry : Banking/Finance Contract Type : Full-time / Contract Overview: We are seeking a skilled Datastage Developer to join our banking client’s dynamic IT team. In this role, you will work on developing, managing, and maintaining ETL processes using IBM DataStage to handle large-scale data integration for financial systems. This is a hybrid position that requires 3 days a week in the office and the remaining days can be worked remotely. Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain ETL workflows using IBM DataStage . Integrate data from multiple sources (structured and unstructured) into data warehouses or data lakes . Work closely with business analysts and stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver optimal solutions. Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security across different systems. Perform data cleansing, transformation , and loading processes (ETL). Optimize performance of existing ETL processes to handle large volumes of data. Collaborate with team members on troubleshooting, debugging, and resolving data-related issues. Maintain documentation of DataStage development processes and workflows. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices for ETL development and data integration . Skills and Qualifications: Strong experience in IBM DataStage development, including job design, data transformations, and parallel jobs. Proficient in SQL , PL/SQL , and database technologies (Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, etc.). Hands-on experience with data integration and ETL processes . Experience in the banking/financial sector is a plus. Knowledge of Unix/Linux scripting for automation and job scheduling. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure. Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. Familiarity with other data tools (e.g., Informatica , Talend , SSIS ) is an advantage. Education & Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science , Engineering , or a related field. 8+ years of experience as a Datastage Developer or similar roles. Experience working in agile or waterfall project environments. Show more Show less

Job Description Are you a curious and open-minded individual with an interest in programming and machine learning? Thomson Reuters Labs in Toronto is seeking an applied scientist intern with a passion for problem-solving using state-of-the-art ML/NLP/IR/GenAI techniques. What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our customers through applied research and development of new products and technologies. The Labs innovate collaboratively across our core segments in Legal, Tax & Accounting, Government, and Reuters News. We undertake a diverse portfolio of projects today while investing in long-term research for the future. As an intern, you will be part of a diverse and interdisciplinary global team of experts. We hire specialists in ML/NLP/IR/GenAI, as well as Engineering and Design to drive the company’s digital and AI transformation. Thomson Reuters Labs is known for consistently delivering successful data-driven Artificial Intelligence solutions in support of high-growth products that serve Thomson Reuters customers in new and exciting ways. The internship duration at Thomson Reuters Labs is typically up to 6 to 8 months and may be aligned with one or two academic semesters or depending upon your availability. About The Role As an Applied research intern, you will: Innovate: You can try new ML/NLP/IR/GenAI approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute ideas and work on solving real-world challenges. Experiment and Develop: You can be involved in the entire model development lifecycle, building, testing, and delivering high-quality solutions. Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will learn from and partner with colleagues across the globe. About You Basic Qualifications: PhD student or MSc recent graduate in a discipline relevant to NLP/ML/IR/Statistics, Practical and relevant experience building NLP/ML/IR/GenAI systems, from ideation to implementation, Software engineering skills for prototyping including: Proficiency in implementing solutions using Python, DL frameworks, and relevant tools, Experience in using code collaboration and versioning systems such as Github, Familiarity with cloud tools such as Amazon AWS, MS Azure, or Google Cloud, Comfortable working with unstructured datasets and are knowledgeable about tools and techniques for data cleaning and processing, Data-driven problem-solving and decision-making mindset, Curious and innovative disposition capable of proposing outside-the-box solutions, Comfortable in communicating (verbal and written) complex AI solutions to audiences with diverse technical backgrounds. Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with attention mechanism and transformer neural networks such as BERT and GPT, Familiarity with generative AI (GenAI) and large language models (LLMs), Familiarity with GenAI supporting technologies such as Prompt Engineering, RAG, Fine-tuning, etc. Publications at relevant venues such as ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGIR, KDD, or similar venues, Ability to translate academic research into working prototypes and experience experimenting with novel NLP/ML/IR models to solve real-world problems, Self-driven attitude and ability to work with limited supervision, Team player and comfortable to collaborate with internal team members and external stakeholders, Comfortable in working in fast-paced, agile environments managing uncertainty and ambiguity. What’s in it For You? You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact Purpose-Driven Work: We have a superpower we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world. Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing. We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. Accessibility As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace. We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more. More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com. Show more Show less
